name: Payment for Successful Additional Weld Test
rule_text: Any welder who is required to do additional testing by the Employer, shall be paid for weld time of four (4) hours per successful test
summary: Welders receive 4 hours of pay for each successful additional weld test required by the employer.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'ADDITIONAL' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PAY(4_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule defines direct payment for time spent on a specific work-related activity (testing), which is a core component of worked time compensation.

name: Reduced Payment for Single Plate Weld Test
rule_text: (excluding the boiler ¼ Down Hand Plate or other single ¼ plate test, will be paid two (2) hours).
summary: As an exception to the standard 4-hour test pay, welders receive 2 hours of pay for a successful boiler ¼ Down Hand Plate or other single ¼ plate test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'BOILER_PLATE_SINGLE' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PAY(2_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule modifies a payment amount for a specific type of work activity (testing), falling under worked time compensation.

name: Maximum Payment for Multi-Plate Weld Test
rule_text: Additional test consists of three plates welded in the vertical, horizontal and overhead positions and will be paid a maximum of four (4) hours total, upon successful completion.
summary: For a specific multi-plate test (vertical, horizontal, overhead), the total payment is capped at a maximum of 4 hours upon successful completion.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'MULTI_PLATE' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PAY(MAX(4_HOURS))
reasoning: This rule sets a maximum payment for a work activity, which is a form of worked time compensation.

name: Payment for Abbreviated Plate Test
rule_text: Those requested to take an abbreviated version of the plate test will be compensated at one and a half (1.5) hours for each successful plate test.
summary: Welders receive 1.5 hours of pay for each successful plate in an abbreviated version of the test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'ABBREVIATED_PLATE' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PAY(1.5_HOURS_PER_PLATE)
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific pay rate for a defined work-related test, which falls under labor worked time.

name: No Payment for Failed Weld Test
rule_text: In any event a welder will not be paid for a failed test.
summary: Welders do not receive any payment for weld tests that they fail.
logical_representation: IF test_result (Unsupported) == 'FAIL' -> PAY(0)
reasoning: This rule explicitly denies payment for time spent on a work activity if a certain condition (failure) is met, defining a zero-pay outcome for worked time.

name: Travel Allowance for On-Site Weld Test
rule_text: If a welder is required to test at the job site, the welder shall be paid for any applicable travel allowance, but not for the failed test.
summary: If a welder must test at the job site, they are eligible for applicable travel allowances. This allowance is paid regardless of test outcome, but the time for a failed test itself is not paid.
logical_representation: IF test_location (llm) == 'ON_SITE' -> ALLOWANCE(TRAVEL)
reasoning: This rule provides an allowance specifically for travel, which falls under the category of subsistence and travel-related compensation.

name: Payment for Partially Successful Weld Tests
rule_text: If an Employer is requesting more than three (3) tests per welder and a welder has successfully completed three (3) of four (4) tests, the Employer may retain the welder and pay for the three (3) successful weld test. If the Employer decides not to retain the welder, he or she will be paid for the three (3) successful weld tests.
summary: When a welder takes four or more tests and passes at least three, they will be paid for the three successful tests, regardless of whether the employer decides to retain them.
logical_representation: IF number_of_tests (llm) >= 4 AND number_of_successful_tests (llm) == 3 -> PAY(FOR_THREE_SUCCESSFUL_TESTS)
reasoning: This is a rule about compensation for time spent on testing, contingent on performance, which is a facet of labor worked time.

name: Employer Responsibility for Weld Test Costs
rule_text: For every required test and any examiner permitted second test the Employer will pay the transfer fees, materials and inspector fees.
summary: The employer is responsible for paying all associated costs for required weld tests, including any permitted second attempts. This includes transfer fees, materials, and inspector fees.
logical_representation: IF test (Unsupported) == 'REQUIRED' OR test (Unsupported) == 'PERMITTED_SECOND_TEST' -> CONSTRAINT(EMPLOYER_PAYS_TEST_FEES)
reasoning: This rule defines an employer obligation directly related to a work activity (testing), ensuring the employee is not financially burdened, which is an entitlement related to the work itself.

name: Payment for Secondary Weld Tests
rule_text: Should a secondary test be required by the Employer, the employee shall be paid for the time required to take such a test.
summary: If an employer requires a welder to take a secondary test, the employee must be paid for the time it takes to complete that test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'SECONDARY' -> PAY(TIME_TAKEN)
reasoning: This rule mandates payment for time spent on a required work activity, which is a core concept of worked time.

name: Practice Material for Non-Standard Tests
rule_text: When a welder is required to perform a test of a type other than a standard Provincial test, the Employer shall, on request, make available suitable material to allow a brief period of practice prior to taking the actual test.
summary: For non-standard Provincial tests, the employer must provide suitable practice materials upon the welder's request before the actual test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'NON_STANDARD_PROVINCIAL' -> PROVIDE(PRACTICE_MATERIAL_ON_REQUEST)
reasoning: This rule provides a non-monetary entitlement directly related to performing a work activity (testing), ensuring fair conditions for completing the work.

name: Travel Reimbursement for Out-of-Town Weld Tests
rule_text: Any welder possessing a current Provincial Government welding certificate of qualification, who is instructed to proceed to take tests, necessitating their having to travel outside of the city limits of the city in which they reside or are employed, shall be reimbursed in an amount necessary to compensate them for travel allowance, transportation, travel expenses, subsistence allowance, if applicable.
summary: Welders with a current provincial certificate who must travel outside their home or employment city for a test will be reimbursed for travel allowance, transportation, travel expenses, and subsistence allowance as applicable.
logical_representation: IF has_provincial_certificate (llm) == true AND test_location (llm) == 'OUTSIDE_CITY_LIMITS' -> ALLOWANCE(TRAVEL) AND ALLOWANCE(TRANSPORTATION) AND ALLOWANCE(EXPENSES) AND ALLOWANCE(SUBSISTENCE)
reasoning: This rule explicitly deals with reimbursement for travel, expenses, and living allowances due to work-related travel, which is the definition of subsistence allowance.

name: Mutual Agreement on Out-of-Town Test Costs
rule_text: The Employer and the Local Lodge will communicate and mutually agree to related costs and test location(s) before proceeding with the testing.
summary: Before out-of-town testing proceeds, the Employer and the Local Lodge must communicate and mutually agree on the associated costs and test locations.
logical_representation: IF test_location (llm) == 'OUTSIDE_CITY_LIMITS' -> CONSTRAINT(MUTUAL_AGREEMENT_ON_COSTS_AND_LOCATION)
reasoning: This rule is a procedural constraint on the payment of travel and subsistence allowances, making it part of that topic.

name: Provision of Weld Test Papers
rule_text: Welders passing a test will be furnished a copy of the test papers from the Employer or party requiring the test within thirty (30) days, or upon completion of the job, whichever is sooner, provided they are available at that time; otherwise the Employer will provide a letter confirming the test and the results.
summary: Welders who pass a test must be given a copy of their test papers within 30 days or at job completion (whichever is sooner). If papers aren't available, a confirmation letter must be provided.
logical_representation: IF test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PROVIDE(TEST_PAPERS_OR_CONFIRMATION_LETTER)
reasoning: This is a non-monetary entitlement tied to the outcome of a work-related activity, ensuring proper documentation of work performed.

name: Fair Conditions for Provincial Certificate Tests
rule_text: Where a welder is to take an official Provincial test on which the issuance or re-issuance of their certificate will depend, they shall not be required to do so under conditions which would unfairly affect their ability to perform the test.
summary: Welders taking an official Provincial test for their certification must be provided fair testing conditions that do not negatively impact their performance.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'OFFICIAL_PROVINCIAL' -> CONSTRAINT(FAIR_TESTING_CONDITIONS)
reasoning: This rule governs the conditions under which a work-related task (testing) is performed, which is an aspect of labor management and fair compensation for effort.

name: Test Conditions for Non-Provincial Tests
rule_text: For other tests, the Employer may prescribe test conditions approximating, but not exceeding, conditions which may be encountered on the job.
summary: For tests other than official Provincial ones, the employer can set test conditions that are similar to, but not more difficult than, actual on-the-job conditions.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) != 'OFFICIAL_PROVINCIAL' -> CONSTRAINT(TEST_CONDITIONS_NOT_EXCEEDING_JOB_CONDITIONS)
reasoning: Similar to the previous rule, this sets parameters for a work activity, ensuring the test is a fair measure of on-the-job capability.

name: Right to Complete Weld Test
rule_text: Welders required to take any test shall be allowed to complete the test.
summary: Any welder who is required to start a test must be allowed to finish it.
logical_representation: IF test (Unsupported) == 'REQUIRED' -> CONSTRAINT(MUST_BE_ALLOWED_TO_COMPLETE)
reasoning: This rule provides a right related to the performance of a work activity, ensuring the worker has a full opportunity to meet the requirements.

name: Forfeiture of Test Pay for Failure to Report to Work
rule_text: Any welder who successfully completes the welding test, but fails to report for work as notified, without a bona fide reason acceptable to the Employer, will not be eligible for any payment, including testing time and other allowances, as set out in Article 7.00.
summary: If a welder passes a test but then fails to show up for work without an acceptable reason, they forfeit all payments and allowances related to that test.
logical_representation: IF test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' AND event (Unsupported) == 'FAILURE_TO_REPORT_FOR_WORK' -> FORFEIT(ALL_TEST_PAY_AND_ALLOWANCES)
reasoning: This rule links payment for a work activity (testing) to a subsequent work obligation (reporting to work), making it a conditional payment rule under worked time.

name: Second Test Opportunity for Pre-Job Weld Test
rule_text: Any welder required to take a pre-job welding test for employment with an Employer and fails the required weld test, the welder may be granted the opportunity to take a second test.
summary: A welder who fails a required pre-job welding test may be given a second chance to take the test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'PRE_JOB' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'FAIL' -> CONDITION(MAY_BE_GRANTED_SECOND_TEST)
reasoning: This is a procedural rule about a work-related activity (pre-employment testing) and does not involve direct payment, but sets conditions for work engagement.

name: Alloy Welder Premium
rule_text: Alloy welders with a valid alloy welding certificate will be paid an additional premium of three dollars and twenty-five cents ($3.25) per hour worked if certification was a requirement for dispatch.
summary: Certified alloy welders receive a premium of $3.25 per hour if they were specifically dispatched because of their alloy certification.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'ALLOY_WELDER' AND has_alloy_certificate (llm) == true AND was_dispatched_for_certification (llm) == true -> PREMIUM($3.25_PER_HOUR)
reasoning: This rule establishes a premium pay rate based on skill and job requirement, a core concept of worked time compensation.

name: On-Site Reclassification to Alloy Welder
rule_text: If a welder on site who was not dispatched as an alloy welder, but has the certification, or is requested to be certified by the Employer and is requested to perform alloy welding, the employee will be reclassified as an alloy welder and paid the alloy welder premium from the date of re-classification.
summary: A welder on site who was not dispatched as an alloy welder but is asked to perform alloy welding (and is certified or becomes certified at the employer's request) will be reclassified as an alloy welder and receive the premium from that date forward.
logical_representation: IF was_dispatched_as_alloy_welder (llm) == false AND has_alloy_certificate (llm) == true AND activity_type (Unsupported) == 'ALLOY_WELDING' -> RECLASSIFY('ALLOY_WELDER') AND PREMIUM($3.25_PER_HOUR)
reasoning: This rule concerns reclassification and the application of a premium based on work performed, directly impacting hourly pay and thus falling under worked time.

name: Alloy Premium Calculation on Overtime
rule_text: This premium shall not pyramid on an overtime hour; however, it will attract applicable Vacation and Statutory Holiday Pay.
summary: The alloy welder premium is a flat hourly addition and is not multiplied for overtime hours. However, it is included when calculating vacation and statutory holiday pay.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'ALLOY_WELDER' -> CONSTRAINT(PREMIUM_NOT_PYRAMIDED_ON_OVERTIME) AND CONDITION(PREMIUM_ATTRACTS_VACATION_AND_STAT_PAY)
reasoning: This rule specifies how a premium interacts with other pay calculations like overtime and vacation pay, which is a key part of worked time compensation logic.

name: Normal Work Day
rule_text: Eight (8) hours per day shall constitute a normal day of work.
summary: A standard workday is defined as eight hours.
logical_representation: DEFINE(NORMAL_DAY_HOURS=8)
reasoning: This rule establishes the baseline for a standard day's work, which is fundamental to calculating daily overtime.

name: Normal Work Week
rule_text: Forty (40) hours shall constitute a normal week's work, Monday through Friday inclusive.
summary: A standard work week is defined as 40 hours, from Monday to Friday.
logical_representation: DEFINE(NORMAL_WEEK_HOURS=40, NORMAL_WORK_DAYS=['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'])
reasoning: This rule sets the weekly straight-time hour threshold and the days of the week, which are key for calculating weekly overtime.

name: Standard Shift Time Window
rule_text: The normal hours of work shall be between the hours of 7:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. for an eight (8) hour day...
summary: The standard hours for an 8-hour workday fall between 7:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours == 8 -> DEFINE(NORMAL_SHIFT_WINDOW='07:00'-'18:00')
reasoning: This rule defines the time window for standard daily hours, which is necessary for rules that penalize work outside these times.

name: Standard Lunch Break
rule_text: ...with one-half (½) or one (1) hour for lunch at the midpoint of the shift.
summary: A standard shift includes an unpaid lunch break of either 30 or 60 minutes, taken around the middle of the shift.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours >= 8 -> PROVIDE(LUNCH_BREAK, DURATION=0.5_OR_1.0_HOURS, PAID=FALSE)
reasoning: This rule defines the standard unpaid meal break, which affects the total paid hours within a shift.

name: Overtime for Unilateral Shift Time Change
rule_text: If the foregoing starting or quitting times are changed without mutual agreement, applicable overtime rates shall be paid for any time worked before or after the above hours as a result of the change of times.
summary: If the employer changes the standard start or end times without mutual agreement, any time worked outside the originally defined hours must be paid at overtime rates.
logical_representation: IF mutual_agreement_on_change (llm) == false -> PAY(OT) FOR hours_worked OUTSIDE defined_shift_window
reasoning: This rule establishes a penalty that converts straight time to overtime under specific conditions, directly impacting labor cost calculation.

name: Compressed Work Week Makeup Day
rule_text: When working under the four (4) day work week schedule, Friday may be used as a make-up day when weather conditions have caused lost time during the regular work week. A make-up day will only be worked during the week in which the time is lost.
summary: On a 4-day compressed work week, Friday can be used as a make-up day if time was lost due to weather earlier that same week.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND lost_time_reason (llm) == 'WEATHER' -> ALLOW(MAKEUP_DAY, day_of_week='FRI')
reasoning: This rule defines the conditions for a special type of workday (makeup day), which has its own specific pay rules.

name: Makeup Day Pay Calculation
rule_text: Work performed on a make-up day shall be paid at the regular straight time rate for the first ten (10) hours to a maximum of forty (40) hours per week, after which double time (2X) rates shall apply.
summary: Work on a makeup day is paid at straight time for up to 10 hours daily and 40 hours weekly. Hours exceeding either of these limits are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF is_makeup_day (Unsupported) == true AND (daily_hours > 10 OR weekly_hours > 40) -> TRANSITION(DT) ELSE PAY(ST)
reasoning: This rule provides the specific thresholds for transitioning from straight time to double time on a makeup day.

name: Makeup Day Minimum Scheduled Hours
rule_text: In no case shall the time scheduled on a make-up day be less than eight (8) hours except where weather conditions dictate otherwise.
summary: A makeup day must be scheduled for a minimum of eight hours, unless weather interferes.
logical_representation: IF is_makeup_day (Unsupported) == true -> MIN(8_HOURS_SCHEDULED)
reasoning: This rule provides a minimum work guarantee for a specific type of workday, ensuring a minimum level of compensation.

name: CWW Weekly Overtime with a Holiday
rule_text: Where a holiday occurs during the normal work week the maximum of thirty (30) hours per week shall form the basis of maximum straight time rate.
summary: If a statutory holiday falls within a compressed work week, the weekly straight-time threshold is reduced from 40 to 30 hours.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true AND schedule_type LIKE '4x%' AND weekly_hours > 30 -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule alters the standard weekly overtime threshold based on the presence of a holiday, which is a critical exception for payroll calculation.

name: Weekend and Holiday Premium Pay
rule_text: Work performed on Saturday, Sunday, or Recognized Holidays shall be paid at the applicable overtime premium.
summary: All hours worked on a Saturday, Sunday, or a recognized holiday are paid at the applicable overtime rate.
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true -> PAY(APPLICABLE_OT_PREMIUM)
reasoning: This rule designates specific days as premium pay days, which is a core component of categorizing worked hours.

name: Work Hours Guarantee
rule_text: Employees will not be required to work less than the regular assigned hours because of the starting or quitting time of any other trade on the job.
summary: An employee's work hours cannot be reduced below their regularly assigned hours due to the schedules of other trades on the job site.
logical_representation: IF other_trade_schedule_impact (llm) == true -> CONSTRAINT(EMPLOYEE_HOURS >= REGULAR_ASSIGNED_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule provides a guarantee of hours under specific circumstances, ensuring employees are paid for their scheduled time.

name: Penalty for Delayed Lunch Break
rule_text: If this break falls outside the regular lunch break established on the job, they shall receive an additional allowance of one-half (½) hour of pay at straight time rates which shall be in addition to their regular straight time hours.
summary: If an employee's rescheduled lunch break occurs outside the normal lunch period, they receive a penalty payment of 30 minutes at straight time.
logical_representation: IF worked_through_lunch_break (llm) == true AND rescheduled_break_timing (llm) OUTSIDE normal_lunch_period -> PAY(0.5_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule dictates a specific monetary penalty for failing to provide a timely meal break, which directly adds to labor costs.

name: Rest Breaks for 8-Hour Shift
rule_text: When working eight (8) hour work shifts, two (2) rest or coffee breaks of ten (10) minutes each shall be established by the Employer.
summary: Employees on an 8-hour shift receive two paid 10-minute rest breaks.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' -> PROVIDE(REST_BREAK, COUNT=2, DURATION=10_MINUTES, PAID=TRUE)
reasoning: This rule defines paid break entitlements, which are counted as worked time and are essential for calculating total paid hours.

name: Rest Break Before Overtime
rule_text: If overtime is to follow the regular eight (8) hour work shift, a further ten (10) minute rest or coffee break shall be established before commencing overtime.
summary: An additional paid 10-minute rest break is given after an 8-hour shift but before overtime work begins.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND daily_hours > 8 -> PROVIDE(REST_BREAK, COUNT=1, DURATION=10_MINUTES, PAID=TRUE, TIMING='PRE_OT')
reasoning: This rule specifies an additional paid break entitlement triggered by working overtime, which is part of the overall worked time calculation.

name: Rest Break Options for 10-Hour Shift
rule_text: At the sole discretion of the Employer, where a scheduled ten (10) hour workday is established, the rest or coffee breaks may be either three (3) breaks of ten (10) minutes each, (described above) or two (2) breaks of fifteen (15) minutes each.
summary: On a 10-hour shift, the employer can choose to provide either three 10-minute paid breaks or two 15-minute paid breaks.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' -> PROVIDE(REST_BREAKS, OPTION_A={COUNT:3, DURATION:10_MINUTES}, OPTION_B={COUNT:2, DURATION:15_MINUTES}, PAID=TRUE)
reasoning: This rule defines the paid break entitlements for a 10-hour schedule, which are included in the total paid hours for the day.

name: Paid Breaks Alternative for 10-Hour Shift
rule_text: When working ten (10) hour shifts, in lieu of the work breaks and lunch breaks provided herein, the Employer shall have the option of scheduling two (2) breaks of one-half (½) hour each, both paid at the applicable rate, approximately equally spaced in the ten (10) hour shift.
summary: For 10-hour shifts, an employer may opt to provide two 30-minute paid breaks instead of the standard coffee breaks and unpaid lunch.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' -> ALLOW(OPTION: PROVIDE(PAID_BREAKS, COUNT=2, DURATION=0.5_HOURS) IN_LIEU_OF (UNPAID_LUNCH, REST_BREAKS))
reasoning: This rule provides an alternative break structure where all breaks are paid, which fundamentally changes how total paid time is calculated for a 10-hour shift.

name: Work Week Definition for Saturday and Sunday Work
rule_text: For the purpose of clarification and to define Saturday and Sunday work, the work shall be deemed to commence at the starting time of the regular day shift on Monday morning.
summary: To define Saturday and Sunday work, the work week is considered to start at the beginning of the regular day shift on Monday.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT('work_week_start' == 'MON_day_shift_start')
reasoning: This rule establishes the starting point of the work week, which is fundamental for calculating weekly hours, overtime, and defining weekend work, all core components of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Shift Start Day Flexibility
rule_text: Shifts may be commenced on any calendar day provided the appropriate requirements for shift premium and overtime as specified in this Agreement are met.
summary: Shifts are permitted to start on any day of the week, provided that the applicable shift premium and overtime rules are followed.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT('shift_start_day' CAN BE ANY day_of_week IF 'premium_and_overtime_rules' == 'APPLIED')
reasoning: This rule governs the scheduling of shifts and ties it directly to pay calculations (premium and overtime), which falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Day Shift Definition and Start Time
rule_text: For  the  purpose  of  defining  the  shifts,  the  1st  shift  shall  be  the  day  shift  which commences  at  7:00  a.m.
summary: The first shift is the day shift, and it is defined as starting at 7:00 a.m.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'DAY' -> CONSTRAINT(shift_start_time (llm) == '07:00')
reasoning: This rule defines a specific shift and its standard start time, which is a foundational element for scheduling and calculating work time.

name: Day Shift Start Time Variation
rule_text: This  starting  time  may  be  varied  by  mutual  agreement  to  suit  job requirements.
summary: The standard 7:00 a.m. start time for the day shift can be changed if both the employer and union agree to it for specific job needs.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'DAY' AND mutual_agreement (llm) == true -> ACTION(VARY(shift_start_time (llm)))
reasoning: This rule provides a mechanism for altering a defined shift schedule, which is a key aspect of managing LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Afternoon and Night Shift Sequence
rule_text: The second (2 nd )  shift  shall  be  the  afternoon  shift  and  shall  follow  the  first  (1 st ) shift. The third (3 rd ) shift shall be the night shift and shall follow the second (2 nd ) shift.
summary: The second shift is the afternoon shift which follows the day shift, and the third shift is the night shift which follows the afternoon shift.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(shift_name (llm) sequence is DAY -> AFTERNOON -> NIGHT)
reasoning: This rule defines the names and sequential order of the shifts, which is essential for applying shift-specific rules and categorizing LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Maximum Gap Between Shifts
rule_text: Second (2 nd ) and third (3 rd ) shifts shall commence not later than one (1) hour after the completion of the preceding shift, except where this is prevented by conditions or requirements beyond the control of the Employer.
summary: The afternoon and night shifts must begin within one hour of the previous shift's completion, unless prevented by circumstances beyond the employer's control.
logical_representation: IF shift_name (llm) IN ['AFTERNOON', 'NIGHT'] -> CONSTRAINT(inter_shift_gap_hours (llm) <= 1)
reasoning: This rule sets a specific constraint on shift scheduling, which is a direct component of managing and defining LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Shift Premium for Afternoon and Night Shifts
rule_text:
A shift premium shall apply on all hours worked on second (2 nd ) and third (3 rd ) shifts at the rates as set out in the Wage and Benefit Schedule.

All shift premium hours will be paid at a rate of four dollars and fifty cents ($4.50) per hour.
summary: A shift premium of $4.50 per hour is paid for all hours worked on the second (afternoon) and third (night) shifts.
logical_representation: IF shift_name (llm) IN ['AFTERNOON', 'NIGHT'] -> PREMIUM($4.50)
reasoning: This rule establishes a pay premium based on the time of day worked (shift type), which is a core component of calculating pay for LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Minimum Rest Period Penalty
rule_text: When an employee is required to return to work without an eight (8) hour break, all work performed  shall  be  paid  for  at  the  applicable  overtime  rates,  until  such  time  as  the  employee receives an eight (8) hour break.
summary: If an employee works without getting an 8-hour break first, all hours worked are paid at overtime rates until an 8-hour break is given.
logical_representation: IF rest_period_hours (llm) < 8 -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('overtime') UNTIL rest_period_hours (llm) >= 8
reasoning: This rule establishes a condition (insufficient rest) that changes the pay rate for hours worked to overtime, which is a direct calculation rule for LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Shift Schedule Change Procedure
rule_text: The  Local  Lodge  agrees  to  discuss  the  flexibility  and  options  of  shift  schedules  as brought forward at the request of the Employer/Owner. No such changes will be implemented without the mutual consent of both parties.  Any and all other  Articles,  Terms and Conditions shall apply.
summary: Changes to shift schedules can only be implemented with the mutual agreement of both the union and the employer/owner, following a discussion initiated by the employer/owner.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(CHANGE(schedule_type) REQUIRES mutual_agreement (llm))
reasoning: This is a procedural rule governing how work schedules can be altered. Since schedules are the basis of LABOR_WORKED_TIME, this rule is classified under that topic.

name: Weekday Overtime Rate (First Tier)
rule_text: When an employee is required to work in excess of the regular hours, Monday through Friday inclusive, they shall be paid overtime at the rate of time and one- half (1 ½) the regular rate of pay.
summary: For employees working Monday to Friday, any hours worked beyond their regular daily hours are paid at time and a half (1.5x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_hours > REGULAR_HOURS -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule establishes the pay rate for the initial tier of overtime on weekdays, which is a core function of categorizing worked time.

name: Weekday Overtime Rate (Second Tier)
rule_text: Double (2) time will be paid after ten (10) hours worked.
summary: On weekdays, any hours worked beyond ten hours in a single day are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_hours > 10 -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule defines the threshold for escalating from time-and-a-half to double time on a weekday, which is a key aspect of classifying labor hours.

name: Weekend and Holiday Overtime Rate
rule_text: Employees working on a Saturday, Sunday, and Recognized Holidays shall be paid an overtime rate at double (2) time the regular rate of pay.
summary: All hours worked on a Saturday, Sunday, or a recognized holiday are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for specific days (weekends and holidays), which is a fundamental rule for categorizing worked time.

name: Overtime, 5x8 Schedule
rule_text:
| Day of Week | Straight Time | Time and One Half (1.5x) | Double Time (2x) |
|---|---|---|---|
| Monday | 8 hours | Up to 2 hours | After 10 hours |
| Tuesday | 8 hours | Up to 2 hours | After 10 hours |
| Wednesday | 8 hours | Up to 2 hours | After 10 hours |
| Thursday | 8 hours | Up to 2 hours | After 10 hours |
| Friday | 8 hours | Up to 2 hours | After 10 hours |
summary: On a 5x8 schedule (Monday-Friday), the first 8 hours are straight time, the next 2 hours (up to 10 total) are time-and-a-half, and any hours worked beyond 10 are double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('IF daily_hours <= 8 -> ST; IF daily_hours > 8 AND daily_hours <= 10 -> OT; IF daily_hours > 10 -> DT')
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines the straight time and overtime thresholds for a specific work schedule (5x8), which is central to categorizing worked time.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Schedule (Mon-Thu)
rule_text:
| Day of Week | Straight Time | Time and One Half (1.5x) | Double Time (2x) |
|---|---|---|---|
| Monday | 10 hours | | After 10 hours |
| Tuesday | 10 hours | | After 10 hours |
| Wednesday | 10 hours | | After 10 hours |
| Thursday | 10 hours | | After 10 hours |
| Friday | | Up to 10 hours | After 10 hours |
summary: On a 4x10 Monday-Thursday schedule, the first 10 hours Monday-Thursday are straight time, with hours after 10 paid at double time. On Friday, the first 10 hours are time-and-a-half, and hours after 10 are double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon_thu' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('IF day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] AND daily_hours <= 10 -> ST; IF day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] AND daily_hours > 10 -> DT; IF day_of_week == 'FRI' AND daily_hours <= 10 -> OT; IF day_of_week == 'FRI' AND daily_hours > 10 -> DT')
reasoning: This rule defines the specific straight time and overtime thresholds for the 4x10 Monday-Thursday work schedule, a key function of classifying labor hours.

name: Overtime, 4x10 Schedule (Tue-Fri)
rule_text:
| Day of Week | Straight Time | Time and One Half (1.5x) | Double Time (2x) |
|---|---|---|---|
| Monday | | Up to 10 hours | After 10 hours |
| Tuesday | 10 hours | | After 10 hours |
| Wednesday | 10 hours | | After 10 hours |
| Thursday | 10 hours | | After 10 hours |
| Friday | 10 hours | | After 10 hours |
summary: On a 4x10 Tuesday-Friday schedule, the first 10 hours Tuesday-Friday are straight time, with hours after 10 paid at double time. On Monday, the first 10 hours are time-and-a-half, and hours after 10 are double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue_fri' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('IF day_of_week IN ['TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_hours <= 10 -> ST; IF day_of_week IN ['TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_hours > 10 -> DT; IF day_of_week == 'MON' AND daily_hours <= 10 -> OT; IF day_of_week == 'MON' AND daily_hours > 10 -> DT')
reasoning: This rule sets the specific straight time and overtime thresholds for the 4x10 Tuesday-Friday work schedule, which is essential for categorizing worked time.

name: Voluntary Unscheduled Overtime
rule_text: Any unscheduled overtime will be voluntary and worked at the employees' discretion.
summary: Employees are not required to work overtime that has not been scheduled in advance; they may choose to work it or not.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type (llm) == 'UNSCHEDULED' -> CONDITION('Work is voluntary')
reasoning: This rule defines a condition related to performing overtime work, establishing it as voluntary. It relates to the conditions under which labor time is worked.

name: Shift Premium on Overtime
rule_text: Employees working overtime shall continue to receive their shift premium for all hours worked. The shift premium shall not be compounded for overtime hours worked.
summary: Employees who receive a shift premium will continue to receive it for any overtime hours worked, but the premium amount itself is not multiplied by the overtime rate.
logical_representation: IF daily_overtime_hours > 0 AND shift_type != 'DAY' -> PAY(SHIFT_PREMIUM) AND CONDITION('Shift premium is not compounded')
reasoning: This rule clarifies how shift premiums are applied during overtime hours, which is a key calculation rule for worked time.

name: First Overtime Meal Break
rule_text: When an employee works beyond ten (10) hours per day, they shall be entitled to a meal break and meal supplied by the Company.
summary: An employee is entitled to a meal and a meal break, provided by the company, after working more than 10 hours in a day.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(MEAL_AND_BREAK)
reasoning: This rule establishes the primary trigger (working beyond 10 hours) for an employee's entitlement to a meal, which falls under meal allowance rules.

name: Subsequent Overtime Meal Breaks
rule_text: The meal break will be provided after ten (10) hours of work and subsequent meal breaks each four (4) hours thereafter.
summary: After the first meal break at 10 hours, an employee is entitled to another meal break for every additional 4 hours of continuous work.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> MEAL_TRIG(1) AND IF (daily_hours - 10) % 4 == 0 -> MEAL_TRIG(NEXT)
reasoning: This rule defines the recurring entitlement for meal breaks during extended overtime, making it a meal allowance rule.

name: Overtime Meal Break Exception (4x10 Schedule)
rule_text: When the four (4) ten (10) hour day option is worked, recognizing emergency situations will arise, if the Company has not scheduled in excess of the ten (10) hour shift, the Company shall be granted a one (1) hour extension where a meal and meal break are not required.
summary: On a 4x10 schedule, if unscheduled emergency overtime occurs, the company is not required to provide a meal or break until the employee has worked 11 hours, a one-hour extension.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type IN ['4x10_mon_thu', '4x10_tue_fri'] AND overtime_type (llm) == 'UNSCHEDULED_EMERGENCY' AND daily_hours <= 11 -> FORFEIT(MEAL_AND_BREAK)
reasoning: This rule creates a specific exception to the standard meal entitlement based on work schedule and overtime type, classifying it as a meal allowance rule.

name: Meal Break on Scheduled Overtime
rule_text: When an employee works Scheduled Overtime (work performed on Saturdays, Sundays and Holidays) they shall be entitled to a meal break when overtime work exceeds ten (10) hours).
summary: During scheduled overtime (Saturdays, Sundays, Holidays), an employee gets a meal break after working more than 10 hours.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type (llm) == 'SCHEDULED' AND daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(MEAL_BREAK)
reasoning: This rule specifies the meal break trigger for a particular type of overtime, which is a core component of meal allowance policies.

name: Meal Break on Emergency Call-Out
rule_text: When an employee works Short Notice Emergency Call-Out Overtime (overtime work performed other than continuous with the regular work day or Scheduled Overtime) they shall be entitled to a meal break when overtime work exceeds four (4) hours.
summary: For emergency call-out overtime that is not continuous with a regular shift, an employee is entitled to a meal break after working more than 4 hours.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type (llm) == 'CALL_OUT' AND daily_overtime_hours > 4 -> PROVIDE(MEAL_BREAK)
reasoning: This rule defines a special, lower-hour threshold for meal break entitlement during emergency call-outs, making it a meal allowance rule.

name: Meal Break Duration and Pay
rule_text: All overtime meal breaks will be thirty (30) minutes in duration and will be paid for at straight time rates.
summary: All overtime meal breaks are 30 minutes long and are paid at the employee's straight time rate.
logical_representation: CONDITION('Overtime meal breaks are 30 minutes') AND PAY(0.5, 'ST')
reasoning: This rule sets the duration and pay status of an overtime meal break, which directly relates to meal entitlements.

name: Meal Break Calculation Exclusion
rule_text: However, in calculating entitlement to a meal, the thirty (30) minute break shall not count as overtime work.
summary: The paid 30-minute meal break does not count as 'time worked' when determining eligibility for subsequent meal breaks.
logical_representation: CONDITION('Paid 30-minute meal break is excluded from daily_hours for calculating subsequent meal entitlements')
reasoning: This rule clarifies how meal break time is treated for calculation purposes, which is an integral part of meal allowance administration.

name: Supervisor Meal Break Exception
rule_text: When a supervisor is required to: a) Start up to one (1) hour earlier, or b) Finish up to one (1) hour later, or c) Start up to one-half (1/2) hour earlier and finish up to one-half (1/2) hour later... the foreperson shall not be entitled to a meal or meal break as per article 13.02, unless those provisions are applicable to the rest of the crew or the supervisor works more than two (2) hours beyond the end of their scheduled shift.
summary: A supervisor who works up to one extra hour before or after their crew for preparatory tasks is not entitled to an overtime meal, unless their crew also qualifies or the supervisor works more than two hours past their shift end.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND daily_hours <= (REGULAR_HOURS + 2) AND additional_time_is_for_prep (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(MEAL_AND_BREAK)
reasoning: This rule creates a specific job-role-based exception to the standard meal entitlement, classifying it as a meal allowance rule.

name: Scheduled Overtime Meal Allowance In Lieu
rule_text: Scheduled Overtime... I) a payment of thirty (30) minutes at the straight-time total package hourly rate in lieu of the meal break, and 2. II) a fifteen (15) minute rest break at the applicable rate of pay.
summary: If a meal is not provided during scheduled overtime when one is due, the employee receives 30 minutes of pay at their straight-time total package rate and a 15-minute paid rest break at the applicable rate.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type (llm) == 'SCHEDULED' AND meal_provided (llm) == false -> PAY(0.5, 'ST_TOTAL_PACKAGE') AND PAY(0.25, 'APPLICABLE_RATE')
reasoning: This rule specifies the monetary and time-off compensation provided when a meal entitlement is not fulfilled, which is a core function of meal allowance policies.

name: Unscheduled Overtime Meal Allowance In Lieu
rule_text: Unscheduled Overtime I) a payment of forty dollars ($40.00) as a meal allowance. 2. II) a payment of thirty (30) minutes at the straight-time total package hourly rate in the lieu of meal break, and 3. III) a fifteen (15) minute rest break at the applicable rate of pay.
summary: If a meal is not provided during unscheduled overtime when one is due, the employee receives a $40 meal allowance, 30 minutes of pay at their straight-time total package rate, and a 15-minute paid rest break at the applicable rate.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type (llm) == 'UNSCHEDULED' AND meal_provided (llm) == false -> ALLOWANCE(40.00) AND PAY(0.5, 'ST_TOTAL_PACKAGE') AND PAY(0.25, 'APPLICABLE_RATE')
reasoning: This rule details the specific monetary and time-off payments for a missed meal during unscheduled overtime, defining it as a meal allowance rule.

name: Meal Allowance for Employees on Subsistence
rule_text: There shall be no meal allowance applicable to those receiving subsistence, however any reduction to the current subsistence rates will attract a meal allowance payment equivalent to the reduction.
summary: Employees receiving a subsistence allowance are not eligible for an additional overtime meal allowance. However, if their subsistence pay is reduced, they will receive a meal allowance equal to the amount of the reduction.
logical_representation: IF is_receiving_subsistence (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(MEAL_ALLOWANCE) UNLESS subsistence_is_reduced (llm) == true
reasoning: This rule establishes an exclusion from meal allowances based on the receipt of subsistence pay, directly linking it to the meal allowance topic.

name: Meal Allowance for Employees in Camp
rule_text: Where a camp is provided, employees will not receive the forty dollars ($40.00) meal allowance where they are able to receive a camp meal at the end of their shift.
summary: Employees staying in a provided camp who can get a meal there after their shift are not eligible for the $40 meal allowance for unscheduled overtime.
logical_representation: IF is_in_camp (llm) == true AND camp_meal_available (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(ALLOWANCE(40.00))
reasoning: This rule specifies a condition (being in a camp) that negates eligibility for a specific meal allowance, making it a meal allowance rule.

name: 12-Hour Shift Implementation
rule_text: Upon written notice to the Local Lodge, the Employer may implement a twelve (12) hour shift with three (3) half hour paid breaks...
summary: The employer can implement a 12-hour shift schedule, which includes three paid 30-minute breaks, after providing written notice to the Union Local.
logical_representation: CONDITION('Employer may implement 12_hour_shift (llm) with written notice')
reasoning: This rule establishes the condition for implementing a specific work schedule, which is a fundamental aspect of defining and categorizing worked time.

name: 12-Hour Shift Pay (4x10 basis)
rule_text: Four (4) x ten (10) Monday to Thursday or Tuesday to Friday: Ten (10) hours @ straight time, two (2) hours @ doubletime (2x)
summary: When a 12-hour shift is based on a 4x10 schedule, employees are paid for 10 hours at straight time and 2 hours at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_shift_4x10_basis (llm)' -> PAY(10, 'ST') AND PAY(2, 'DT')
reasoning: This rule defines how hours are categorized and paid for a specific schedule (12-hour shift), which is a core function of labor worked time rules.

name: 12-Hour Shift Pay (5x8 basis)
rule_text: Five (5) x eight (8) Monday to Friday: Eight (8) hours @ straight time, two (2) hours at time and one half (1 ½), two (2) hours at doubletime (2x)
summary: When a 12-hour shift is based on a 5x8 schedule, employees are paid for 8 hours at straight time, 2 hours at time-and-a-half, and 2 hours at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_shift_5x8_basis (llm)' -> PAY(8, 'ST') AND PAY(2, 'OT') AND PAY(2, 'DT')
reasoning: This rule defines the specific pay breakdown for a 12-hour shift on a 5x8 basis, which is a fundamental rule for categorizing worked time.

name: 12-Hour Shift Breaks
rule_text: There are to be three (3) half hour paid breaks.
summary: Employees on a 12-hour shift are entitled to three paid 30-minute breaks.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_shift (llm)' -> PROVIDE(3 x 30_minute_paid_breaks)
reasoning: This rule defines the break entitlement within a specific work schedule. Since the breaks are paid, they are part of the calculation of total paid hours, thus falling under worked time.

name: Holiday Time Off Entitlement
rule_text: All employees covered by this Agreement shall be entitled to time off for the Recognized Holidays.
summary: All employees are entitled to take recognized holidays off from work.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> PROVIDE(TIME_OFF)
reasoning: This rule establishes the fundamental entitlement to time off on a holiday, which is a condition of work time.

name: Holiday Pay Allowance
rule_text: The pay allowance as provided for in the appropriate Appendix shall be included in the employees'  weekly  pay.  This  pay  allowance  shall  be  in  lieu  of  actual  pay  for  any  of  the Recognized Holidays as specified herein.
summary: Employees receive a holiday pay allowance in their weekly pay instead of regular pay for the holiday itself, if they are not working.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true AND employee_not_working (llm) == true -> PAY(HOLIDAY_ALLOWANCE)
reasoning: This rule defines the pay mechanism for a non-worked holiday, directly related to labor time and compensation.

name: Holiday Pay Allowance Calculation Basis
rule_text: This  pay  allowance  shall  be  applied  to  gross  wages  for  all  hours  earned  including: overtime and shift premium; and also to waiting and reporting time per Article 15.00; daily travel allowance per Article 16.01.
summary: The holiday pay allowance is calculated based on gross wages, which includes all earned hours like overtime, shift premiums, waiting/reporting time, and travel allowances.
logical_representation: CALCULATE(HOLIDAY_ALLOWANCE) BASED ON(gross_wages(including_overtime, shift_premium, waiting_time, reporting_time, travel_allowance))
reasoning: This is a calculation rule that specifies how holiday pay is determined, which falls under how labor time is compensated.

name: 4x10 Overtime Pay, 11 Hours On Site, 15-min Break
rule_text: | Time on Site 11 | ST 10 | OT N/A | DT 1 | Meal ST 0.5 | Overtime Break is 15-min |
summary: On a 4x10 schedule with a 15-minute overtime break, if an employee is on site for 11 hours, they are paid for 10 hours at straight time, 1 hour at double time, and receive an additional 0.5 hours of straight time pay for a meal.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND overtime_break_duration (llm) == '15_MIN' AND time_on_site_hours (llm) == 11 -> PAY(10_ST) AND PAY(1_DT) AND PAY(0.5_MEAL_ST)
reasoning: This rule dictates how worked time is categorized into pay buckets (ST, DT) and includes a meal pay component, spanning both topics. The primary is worked time as it defines the overtime categorization.

name: 4x10 Overtime Pay, 12 Hours On Site, 15-min Break
rule_text: | Time on Site 12 | ST 10 | OT N/A | DT 2 | Meal ST 0.5 | Overtime Break is 15-min |
summary: On a 4x10 schedule with a 15-minute overtime break, if an employee is on site for 12 hours, they are paid for 10 hours at straight time, 2 hours at double time, and receive an additional 0.5 hours of straight time pay for a meal.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND overtime_break_duration (llm) == '15_MIN' AND time_on_site_hours (llm) == 12 -> PAY(10_ST) AND PAY(2_DT) AND PAY(0.5_MEAL_ST)
reasoning: This rule dictates how worked time is categorized into pay buckets (ST, DT) and includes a meal pay component. The primary focus is the categorization of hours worked.

name: 4x10 Overtime Pay, 13 Hours On Site, 15-min Break
rule_text: | Time on Site 13 | ST 10 | OT N/A | DT 3 | Meal ST 0.5 | Overtime Break is 15-min |
summary: On a 4x10 schedule with a 15-minute overtime break, if an employee is on site for 13 hours, they are paid for 10 hours at straight time, 3 hours at double time, and receive an additional 0.5 hours of straight time pay for a meal.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND overtime_break_duration (llm) == '15_MIN' AND time_on_site_hours (llm) == 13 -> PAY(10_ST) AND PAY(3_DT) AND PAY(0.5_MEAL_ST)
reasoning: This rule dictates how worked time is categorized into pay buckets (ST, DT) and includes a meal pay component. The primary focus is the categorization of hours worked.

name: 4x10 Overtime Pay, 11 Hours On Site, 30-min Break
rule_text: | Time on Site 11 | ST 10 | OT N/A | DT 1 | Meal ST N/A | Overtime Break is 30-min |
summary: On a 4x10 schedule with a 30-minute overtime break, if an employee is on site for 11 hours, they are paid for 10 hours at straight time and 1 hour at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND overtime_break_duration (llm) == '30_MIN' AND time_on_site_hours (llm) == 11 -> PAY(10_ST) AND PAY(1_DT)
reasoning: This rule dictates how worked time is categorized into pay buckets (ST, DT) based on hours on site and break duration. This is purely about worked time calculation.

name: 4x10 Overtime Pay, 12 Hours On Site, 30-min Break
rule_text: | Time on Site 12 | ST 10 | OT N/A | DT 2 | Meal ST N/A | Overtime Break is 30-min |
summary: On a 4x10 schedule with a 30-minute overtime break, if an employee is on site for 12 hours, they are paid for 10 hours at straight time and 2 hours at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND overtime_break_duration (llm) == '30_MIN' AND time_on_site_hours (llm) == 12 -> PAY(10_ST) AND PAY(2_DT)
reasoning: This rule dictates how worked time is categorized into pay buckets (ST, DT) based on hours on site and break duration. This is purely about worked time calculation.

name: 4x10 Overtime Pay, 13 Hours On Site, 30-min Break
rule_text: | Time on Site 13 | ST 10 | OT N/A | DT 3 | Meal ST N/A | Overtime Break is 30-min |
summary: On a 4x10 schedule with a 30-minute overtime break, if an employee is on site for 13 hours, they are paid for 10 hours at straight time and 3 hours at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND overtime_break_duration (llm) == '30_MIN' AND time_on_site_hours (llm) == 13 -> PAY(10_ST) AND PAY(3_DT)
reasoning: This rule dictates how worked time is categorized into pay buckets (ST, DT) based on hours on site and break duration. This is purely about worked time calculation.

name: List of Recognized Holidays
rule_text:
The following Recognized Holidays are observed by this Agreement:

| New Year's Day   | Family Day                                |
|------------------|-------------------------------------------|
| Good Friday      | Victoria Day                              |
| Canada Day       | Civic Day                                 |
| Labour Day       | National Day for Truth and Reconciliation |
| Thanksgiving Day | Remembrance Day                           |
| Christmas Day    | Boxing Day                                |
summary: This rule lists the twelve specific days recognized as holidays under the agreement: New Year's Day, Family Day, Good Friday, Victoria Day, Canada Day, Civic Day, Labour Day, National Day for Truth and Reconciliation, Thanksgiving Day, Remembrance Day, Christmas Day, and Boxing Day.
logical_representation: DEFINE(is_stat_holiday) INCLUDES ('NEW_YEARS_DAY', 'FAMILY_DAY', 'GOOD_FRIDAY', 'VICTORIA_DAY', 'CANADA_DAY', 'CIVIC_DAY', 'LABOUR_DAY', 'NATIONAL_DAY_TRUTH_RECONCILIATION', 'THANKSGIVING_DAY', 'REMEMBRANCE_DAY', 'CHRISTMAS_DAY', 'BOXING_DAY')
reasoning: This rule defines which days are considered statutory holidays, which is a key component for determining pay and time off rules related to labor.

name: Additional Government Proclaimed Holidays
rule_text: And any other Holiday(s) that may be proclaimed by Federal or Provincial Governments during the life of this Agreement.
summary: Any additional holidays proclaimed by the federal or provincial governments will also be recognized as holidays under this agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_gov_proclaimed_holiday (llm) == true -> SET(is_stat_holiday, true)
reasoning: This rule extends the definition of a statutory holiday, which directly impacts labor time classification and pay.

name: Pay Rate for Working on a Recognized Holiday
rule_text: Employees working on a Recognized Holiday shall be paid an overtime rate at double (2) time the regular rate of pay.
summary: Employees who work on a recognized holiday must be paid at double their regular rate of pay.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for labor performed on a specific day type (holiday), a core concept of worked time.

name: Weekend Holiday Observance (General)
rule_text: Should any of the above listed holidays (Article 14.02) occur on a Saturday or Sunday, such  holiday  shall  be  observed  on  the  preceding  Friday  or  on  the  Monday  following  unless changed by mutual agreement between the Employer and the Local Lodge Representative.
summary: If a recognized holiday falls on a Saturday or Sunday, it will be observed on the adjacent Friday or Monday, unless otherwise agreed upon.
logical_representation: IF original_holiday_date (llm).day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] -> SET(observed_holiday_date (llm)) = ['PREVIOUS_FRI', 'FOLLOWING_MON'] UNLESS AGREED_WITH(union_local (Unsupported))
reasoning: This rule defines which calendar day is treated as the holiday for pay and work purposes, which is fundamental to categorizing labor time.

name: Weekly Straight Time Maximum on 4x10 Holiday Week
rule_text: When the four (4) ten (10) hour day option is being worked and a Holiday falls during the normal work week the maximum of thirty (30) hours per week shall form the basis of maximum straight time.
summary: On a 4x10 schedule, if a holiday occurs during the work week, the maximum number of straight-time hours for that week is reduced to 30.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND is_stat_holiday_in_work_week (llm) == true -> SET(weekly_hours_threshold_ST, 30)
reasoning: This rule sets the threshold for when overtime begins in a specific weekly scenario (a holiday week on a 4x10 schedule), directly affecting the calculation of worked time.

name: Holiday Observance on 5x8 Schedule
rule_text: When working the five (5) x eight (8) hour work week and the recognized holiday falls in the  work  week the holiday is observed on the day it falls.  If the holiday falls  on Saturday or Sunday, it is moved to the preceding Friday or the following Monday.
summary: For employees on a 5x8 schedule, a holiday is observed on the day it falls. If it lands on a weekend, it's moved to the adjacent Friday or Monday.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND original_holiday_date (llm).day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] -> SET(observed_holiday_date (llm)) = original_holiday_date (llm). ELSE IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND original_holiday_date (llm).day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] -> SET(observed_holiday_date (llm)) = ['PREVIOUS_FRI', 'FOLLOWING_MON']
reasoning: Specifies how to determine the day treated as a holiday based on the work schedule, which is a core rule for time classification.

name: Holiday Observance on 4x10 Schedule (Mid-Week)
rule_text: When working the four (4) x ten (10) hour work week and the recognized holiday falls in the work week it will be observed on the day it falls.
summary: For employees on a 4x10 schedule, a holiday that falls within their scheduled work week is observed on the actual day it occurs.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND is_holiday_in_work_week (llm) == true -> SET(observed_holiday_date (llm)) = original_holiday_date (llm)
reasoning: Specifies how to determine the day treated as a holiday based on the work schedule, which is a core rule for time classification.

name: Holiday Observance and Pay on 4x10 Mon-Thu for a Friday Holiday
rule_text: When working  the  four  (4)  x  ten  (10)  hour  work  week  Monday  to  Thursday  and  the recognized holiday falls on the Friday it will be moved to the preceding Thursday. Thursday is the double time day and Friday is the time and one-half day.
summary: On a Monday-Thursday 4x10 schedule, if a holiday falls on Friday, the holiday is observed on the preceding Thursday. On that week, work on Thursday is paid at double time, and work on Friday is paid at time and a half.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon_thu' AND original_holiday_date (llm).day_of_week == 'FRI' -> SET(observed_holiday_date (llm)) = 'PREVIOUS_THU'. AND FOR_WORK_ON('THU') -> PREMIUM(2.0). AND FOR_WORK_ON('FRI') -> PREMIUM(1.5)
reasoning: This rule contains conditions for both changing the day of holiday observance and setting specific overtime rates for certain days of the week, both of which are central to classifying and paying for worked time.

name: Holiday Observance on 4x10 Mon-Thu for a Weekend Holiday
rule_text: If the holiday falls on Saturday or Sunday, it is moved to the following Monday.
summary: On a Monday-Thursday 4x10 schedule, if a holiday falls on a weekend, it is observed on the following Monday.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon_thu' AND original_holiday_date (llm).day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] -> SET(observed_holiday_date (llm)) = 'FOLLOWING_MON'
reasoning: This rule determines the calendar day treated as a holiday for pay and work purposes based on the work schedule, which is fundamental to categorizing labor time.

name: Holiday Observance on 4x10 Tue-Fri for a Monday Holiday
rule_text: When working the four (4) x ten (10) hour work week Tuesday to Friday and the holiday falls  on  the  Monday  it  is  observed  on  the  Tuesday.
summary: On a Tuesday-Friday 4x10 schedule, if a holiday falls on a Monday, it is observed on the Tuesday.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue_fri' AND original_holiday_date (llm).day_of_week == 'MON' -> SET(observed_holiday_date (llm)) = 'FOLLOWING_TUE'
reasoning: This rule determines the calendar day treated as a holiday based on the work schedule, which is fundamental to categorizing labor time.

name: Holiday Observance on 4x10 Tue-Fri for a Weekend Holiday
rule_text: If it falls  on  Saturday  or  Sunday,  it  is observed on the preceding Friday or on the following Tuesday.
summary: On a Tuesday-Friday 4x10 schedule, if a holiday falls on a weekend, it is observed on either the preceding Friday or the following Tuesday.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue_fri' AND original_holiday_date (llm).day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] -> SET(observed_holiday_date (llm)) = ['PREVIOUS_FRI', 'FOLLOWING_TUE']
reasoning: This rule provides options for which calendar day is treated as a holiday based on the work schedule, directly impacting labor time classification.

name: Employer Notice for Holiday Observance Date
rule_text: Employers  will  post  the  date  to  be  observed  no  later  than  seven  (7)  days  prior  to  the holiday.
summary: Employers are required to post a notice of the date a holiday will be observed at least seven days in advance.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: Employer must POST(observed_holiday_date (llm)) >= 7 days BEFORE(original_holiday_date (llm))
reasoning: This is an administrative rule related to holidays. It doesn't directly affect pay calculation but is a condition related to the work schedule and holidays, so LABOR_WORKED_TIME is the closest fit.

name: Holiday Observance Change for Site Harmonization
rule_text: In  order  to  harmonize  (Client,  multi-Employer)  observance  on  maintenance  sites  the Employer may make a request to the Local Lodge within fourteen (14) days of the holiday to establish another day to be observed other than those noted above.
summary: To align with other employers or the client on a maintenance site, an employer can request to change the observed holiday date by applying to the Local Lodge within 14 days of the holiday.
logical_representation: CONDITION: For site_type (llm) == 'MAINTENANCE', Employer MAY REQUEST change_of_observed_holiday_date (llm) FROM union_local (Unsupported) WITHIN 14 days OF original_holiday_date (llm)
reasoning: This rule provides a mechanism to alter the work schedule by changing the holiday observance date, which directly impacts labor time classification.

name: Waiting Time Pay, First Two Days
rule_text: When an employee, on initial hire or transfer to a project, is instructed by the Employer to report to a job location on a certain day but is not placed to work until a later date, they shall be  entitled  to  two  (2)  hours  pay, ... for  each  of  the  first  two  (2) regular working days they are kept waiting.
summary: A new or transferred employee who reports to a job but is not put to work is paid for 2 hours for each of the first two regular working days they are kept waiting.
logical_representation: IF (employee_status == 'NEW_HIRE' OR employee_status == 'TRANSFER') AND waiting_days <= 2 -> PAY(2_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule defines payment for non-worked time under specific conditions (waiting for work to start), which falls under the categorization and compensation of labor time.

name: Waiting Time Subsistence Entitlement
rule_text: ...plus  subsistence  if  applicable,  for  each  of  the  first  two  (2) regular working days they are kept waiting.
summary: An employee eligible for waiting time pay for the first two days is also entitled to receive subsistence if applicable.
logical_representation: IF (employee_status == 'NEW_HIRE' OR employee_status == 'TRANSFER') AND waiting_days <= 2 -> ALLOWANCE(SUBSISTENCE)
reasoning: This rule explicitly grants a subsistence allowance in conjunction with waiting time, making it a subsistence rule.

name: Waiting Time Pay, After Two Days
rule_text: Thereafter the waiting pay shall be increased to a full day of pay (i.e. eight (8) hours) for each regular working day.
summary: After waiting for two regular working days, the waiting time pay for a new or transferred employee increases to a full 8-hour day for each subsequent waiting day.
logical_representation: IF (employee_status == 'NEW_HIRE' OR employee_status == 'TRANSFER') AND waiting_days > 2 -> PAY(8_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule defines an increased payment rate for non-worked time after a specific waiting period, which is a core component of labor time compensation rules.

name: Waiting Time Pay Duration
rule_text: This waiting pay shall continue until the employee is given work or released from the job in which latter case Article 15.02 (c) shall govern.
summary: Waiting time pay continues until the employee either starts working or is released from the job.
logical_representation: IF employee_status == 'WAITING' -> CONTINUE_PAY UNTIL work_start_status == 'STARTED' OR employee_status == 'LAID_OFF'
reasoning: This rule sets the start and end conditions for a specific pay entitlement, directly relating to the calculation and duration of labor time compensation.

name: Reporting Time, Inclement Weather
rule_text: When an employee reports to work and cannot work because of inclement weather they shall be paid two (2) hours reporting time and the employee must remain on the job for the two (2) hour period, unless otherwise instructed by the Employer's supervisor.
summary: If an employee reports for work but cannot start due to bad weather, they receive 2 hours of pay and must stay on site for those 2 hours unless their supervisor releases them.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status == 'NOT_STARTED' AND cause_of_work_stoppage == 'INCLEMENT_WEATHER' -> PAY(2_HOURS) AND OBLIGATION(REMAIN_ON_SITE)
reasoning: This is a minimum pay guarantee for showing up to work, which is a core concept of labor time rules, defining compensation for non-worked but reported time.

name: Minimum Pay, Work Stopped Due to Weather
rule_text: When an employee has commenced work and is instructed to stop due to inclement weather, they shall be paid for the actual time worked. In no case shall an employee receive less than two (2) hours of pay.
summary: If work starts but is then stopped because of bad weather, the employee is paid for the hours they worked, with a minimum payment of 2 hours.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status == 'STARTED' AND cause_of_work_stoppage == 'INCLEMENT_WEATHER' -> PAY(MIN(2_HOURS, daily_hours))
reasoning: This rule establishes a minimum pay guarantee for a shift that is cut short, a key aspect of labor time compensation.

name: Reporting Time, Work Not Available
rule_text: When an employee reports to work and is not given the opportunity to work because none is available or was not advised before the completion of the previous day of work, they shall be paid two (2) hours of reporting time and allowed to leave the job immediately.
summary: If an employee reports to work and finds no work is available, and they were not notified the day before, they receive 2 hours of pay and can leave immediately.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status == 'NOT_STARTED' AND cause_of_work_stoppage == 'WORK_NOT_AVAILABLE' AND prior_notification == false -> PAY(2_HOURS) AND RELEASED_FROM_SITE
reasoning: This rule provides a minimum payment for reporting to a shift that is subsequently canceled without notice, falling under worked time rules.

name: Minimum Pay, Work Stopped by Employer
rule_text: When an employee has started to work on their regular shift and is instructed to stop, they shall be paid for the actual time worked. In no case shall the employee receive less than two (2) hours of pay.
summary: If an employee starts their shift and is later told to stop working by the employer, they are paid for the time they worked, with a guaranteed minimum of 2 hours' pay.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status == 'STARTED' -> PAY(MIN(2_HOURS, daily_hours))
reasoning: This is a minimum pay guarantee for a partially worked shift, which is a classic labor time rule.

name: Voluntary Work Stoppage Pay
rule_text: If an employee stops work for reasons of their own, and without the approval of the Employer, they shall be entitled to pay only for the hours actually worked in the day and minimum conditions shall not apply.
summary: An employee who stops working for their own reasons without permission is only paid for the hours they actually worked; any minimum pay guarantees do not apply.
logical_representation: IF voluntary_stoppage == true -> PAY(daily_hours) AND FORFEIT(MINIMUM_PAY)
reasoning: This rule defines an exception to minimum pay guarantees, thus it is about how labor time is calculated and paid.

name: Employer Prerogative to Stop Work
rule_text: Subject to all of the above, it shall be the Employer's prerogative to decide whenever work shall be stopped during the day for any reason.
summary: The employer has the ultimate authority to decide when to stop work during the day for any reason, subject to the other rules in this article.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(EMPLOYER_RIGHT_TO_STOP_WORK)
reasoning: While a management rights clause, it directly impacts work duration and pay entitlements, placing it within the scope of labor time.

name: Subsistence with Reporting or Waiting Time
rule_text: An employee who is affected by the Conditions set out above shall be entitled to subsistence in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement.
summary: Any employee who qualifies for waiting or reporting time pay is also entitled to receive subsistence pay as defined elsewhere in the agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_eligible_for_reporting_pay == true OR is_eligible_for_waiting_pay == true -> ALLOWANCE(SUBSISTENCE)
reasoning: The rule's primary function is to grant a subsistence allowance under specific conditions related to reporting or waiting time.

name: Shift Premium on Reporting and Waiting Time
rule_text: When an employee qualifies for reporting or waiting time, such time shall include the regular shift premium when applicable.
summary: If an employee qualifies for reporting or waiting time pay, that pay must also include any applicable shift premium.
logical_representation: IF (is_eligible_for_reporting_pay == true OR is_eligible_for_waiting_pay == true) AND shift_type != null -> APPLY_PAY_RULES(SHIFT_PREMIUM)
reasoning: This rule modifies the calculation of a pay entitlement (reporting/waiting time) by including a premium, making it a labor time rule.

name: Reporting Time Forfeiture with Notification
rule_text: When an employee is notified eight (8) hours prior to the commencement of the scheduled starting time not to report for work, then such employee will not be entitled to any reporting time.
summary: An employee is not eligible for reporting time pay if they are notified not to come to work at least 8 hours before their shift starts.
logical_representation: IF notification_hours >= 8 -> FORFEIT(REPORTING_PAY)
reasoning: This rule defines a condition under which a pay entitlement (reporting time) is forfeited, which is a core labor time concept.

name: Reduced Notification for Camp Jobs
rule_text: On camp jobs, the notice time may be reduced to one (1) hour prior to starting time.
summary: For employees on camp jobs, the notification period to avoid paying reporting time is reduced from 8 hours to just 1 hour before the shift.
logical_representation: IF job_location_type == 'CAMP' AND notification_hours >= 1 -> FORFEIT(REPORTING_PAY)
reasoning: This rule modifies the condition for forfeiting a pay entitlement based on location, which is a labor time rule.

name: Layoff Option After Frequent Cancellations
rule_text: If this occurs more than twice in any one week, Monday through Friday, then the employee shall, at their option, be entitled to a layoff, however, this does not pertain to the normal Christmas break (i.e. two (2) weeks).
summary: If an employee is told not to report for work more than twice in a single Monday-to-Friday week, they have the option to accept a layoff. This does not apply during the Christmas break.
logical_representation: IF cancellation_frequency_per_week > 2 AND time_period != 'CHRISTMAS_BREAK' -> OPTION(EMPLOYEE_CHOICE_LAYOFF)
reasoning: This rule provides an employment status option based on the frequency of work cancellation, which is related to labor time and availability for work.

name: No Reporting Time During Strike
rule_text: When an employee is unable to report for work due to a strike or work stoppage on the project where they are employed, such employee will not be entitled to any reporting time.
summary: Employees are not entitled to reporting time pay if they cannot get to work because of a strike or work stoppage at their project.
logical_representation: IF cause_of_work_stoppage == 'STRIKE' OR cause_of_work_stoppage == 'WORK_STOPPAGE' -> FORFEIT(REPORTING_PAY)
reasoning: It specifies a condition for forfeiting reporting pay, a labor time entitlement.

name: Daily Allowances During Injury Care
rule_text: If an employee meets with an accident during working hours...they shall be paid those amounts as compensation as prescribed in the Workers' Compensation Act and shall also receive any other applicable daily allowances until such time that the employee is no longer in Employer's care.
summary: An employee injured on the job will continue to receive applicable daily allowances (like subsistence) as long as they are considered to be under the employer's care, in addition to WCB payments.
logical_representation: IF workplace_injury_status == 'UNDER_EMPLOYER_CARE' -> ALLOWANCE(DAILY_ALLOWANCES)
reasoning: The rule grants daily allowances, which often includes subsistence, under specific injury-related conditions. This aligns with allowances for remote or special work conditions.

name: Pay for Non-Lost Time Accident
rule_text: If it is not a lost time accident covered by Workers' Compensation, they shall also be paid for the remaining unworked normal daily hours for that day (e.g. eight (8) hours, or in case of a compressed work day ten (10) hours) at the applicable rate.
summary: If an employee has a workplace accident that doesn't result in lost time covered by WCB, they are paid for their full regular shift (e.g., 8 or 10 hours) for that day.
logical_representation: IF workplace_injury_status == 'NON_LOST_TIME_ACCIDENT' -> PAY(REMAINING_SHIFT_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule guarantees full pay for a shift interrupted by a minor injury, making it a labor time compensation rule.

name: Pay for Camp Room Move
rule_text: Should an employee residing in camp accommodation be requested by the Employer or the Clients' designated camp management personnel to move to another room or camp, they are to do it during work hours and will be paid at appropriate rates or the employee shall be paid two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rate to carry out the move, if done outside work hours.
summary: An employee in a camp who is required to move rooms must be paid for the time. If the move happens during work hours, it's paid time; if outside work hours, they receive 2 hours of straight-time pay.
logical_representation: IF activity_type == 'CAMP_ROOM_MOVE' AND timing_of_activity == 'DURING_WORK_HOURS' -> PAY(APPROPRIATE_RATE) ELSE IF activity_type == 'CAMP_ROOM_MOVE' AND timing_of_activity == 'OUTSIDE_WORK_HOURS' -> PAY(2_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: The rule defines payment for a specific, non-production activity, which falls under how time is compensated and is therefore a labor time rule.

name: Exception for Camp Room Move Pay
rule_text: This provision will not apply where employees are required to pack their room at the end of a work cycle or to facilitate a move that will occur during the employees furlough.
summary: Pay for moving rooms does not apply if the employee is packing up at the end of their work rotation or for a move that will happen while they are on their days off (furlough).
logical_representation: IF activity_type == 'CAMP_ROOM_MOVE' AND (reason_for_move == 'END_OF_CYCLE' OR reason_for_move == 'DURING_FURLOUGH') -> FORFEIT(MOVE_PAY)
reasoning: This defines an exception to a pay rule for a specific activity, making it a labor time rule.

name: Transportation for Camp Move
rule_text: Transportation will be supplied if required.
summary: If an employee is required to move rooms in camp, transportation will be provided if necessary.
logical_representation: IF activity_type == 'CAMP_ROOM_MOVE' -> PROVIDE(TRANSPORTATION)
reasoning: While not a direct monetary allowance, providing transportation is a non-monetary benefit related to the logistics of working away from home, which aligns most closely with the concept of subsistence and travel allowances.

name: Employer Provided Transport (45-120km)
rule_text: On those projects that are located between forty-five (45) radius kilometers to one hundred and twenty (120) radius kilometers from Edmonton and/or Calgary City Hall(s) or other Hiring Hall locations, the Employer shall supply suitable transportation to and from the project and mutually agreed to pick-up points.
summary: For projects located between 45 and 120 radius kilometers from a designated city hall or hiring hall, the employer is required to provide transportation for employees to and from agreed-upon pickup points.
logical_representation: IF (project_distance_from_city_hall_km >= 45 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km <= 120) OR (project_distance_from_hiring_hall >= 45 AND project_distance_from_hiring_hall <= 120) -> PROVIDE(TRANSPORTATION)
reasoning: The rule describes a travel-related benefit (transportation) which falls under the broader category of subsistence and remote work allowances.

name: Daily Travel Allowance Alternative (45-120km)
rule_text: Alternatively, the Employer shall pay to each employee a transportation cost at the rate of sixty-nine cents ($0.69) per road kilometer for each day worked or reported for work, from the edge of the forty-five (45) radius kilometer free zone to the project and return.
summary: As an alternative to providing transportation for projects 45-120km away, the employer can pay a travel allowance of $0.69 per kilometer for the distance traveled from the 45km free zone to the project and back. This is paid for each day worked or reported.
logical_representation: IF (project_distance_from_city_hall_km >= 45 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km <= 120) AND work_status IN ['WORKED', 'REPORTED'] -> PAY(0.69 * travel_distance_from_free_zone_km * 2)
reasoning: This rule details a monetary allowance for daily travel, which is a core component of subsistence policies.

name: Review of Daily Travel Cost
rule_text: The transportation cost will be reviewed by the Boilermaker/BCA Liaison Committee should there be general increases or reductions in the reference agreements.
summary: The daily travel allowance rate will be reviewed by a joint committee if there are changes in the reference agreements.
logical_representation: IF reference_agreement_change == true -> TRIGGER_REVIEW(transportation_cost)
reasoning: This rule governs the process for updating travel allowances, which is an administrative aspect of subsistence policies.

name: Subsistence Eligibility (>120km)
rule_text: Subsistence will be paid or camp provided on projects which are more than one hundred and twenty (120) radius kilometers from the City Hall(s) of Edmonton and Calgary or other Hiring Hall locations.
