logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 AND transportation_provided_by_employer (llm) == false -> IF validity_start_date >= '2009-05-04' THEN ALLOWANCE(36.00, 'per_day_worked') ELSE ALLOWANCE(33.00, 'per_day_worked')
reasoning: This rule provides a specific monetary allowance for travel, which is a form of subsistence designed to cover commuting costs for employees not eligible for full room and board. This fits within LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Travel Allowance for Industrial Local Residents 45-75km (With Employer Transport)
rule_text: or if transportation is supplied by the Employer, a daily travel allowance of seventeen dollars ($17.00) ($19.00 per day worked effective May 4/09) will be paid for each day worked.
summary: On industrial projects, local residents living 45-75 km from the site receive a reduced daily travel allowance if the employer provides transportation. The rate is $17.00 per day worked, increasing to $19.00 effective May 4, 2009.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 AND transportation_provided_by_employer (llm) == true -> IF validity_start_date >= '2009-05-04' THEN ALLOWANCE(19.00, 'per_day_worked') ELSE ALLOWANCE(17.00, 'per_day_worked')
reasoning: This rule defines a specific monetary allowance for travel under certain conditions, making it a form of subsistence allowance.

name: Fort McMurray Area Residency Equivalency
rule_text: For the purposes of determining local residents in the Fort McMurray area, residents of Anzac and Saprae Creek will be considered to be residents of Fort McMurray for projects north of Fort McMurray and residents of Fort McKay will be considered to be residents of Fort McMurray for projects located south of Fort McMurray
summary: For determining local residency near Fort McMurray, residents of Anzac/Saprae Creek are treated as Fort McMurray residents for projects to the north, and Fort McKay residents are treated as Fort McMurray residents for projects to the south.
logical_representation: IF (project_location (Unsupported) == 'NORTH_OF_FORT_MCMURRAY' AND employee_residence_location (llm) IN ['Anzac', 'Saprae Creek']) OR (project_location (Unsupported) == 'SOUTH_OF_FORT_MCMURRAY' AND employee_residence_location (llm) == 'Fort McKay') -> CONDITION(is_local_resident (Unsupported) based on Fort McMurray)
reasoning: This rule modifies the definition and determination of local residency status for specific geographic areas. Since local residency is the key condition for subsistence and travel allowances, this rule belongs to the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Noon Meal for Local Residents from Camp Kitchen
rule_text: Where a Camp Kitchen is established, and where all workers generally on the project who are not Local Residents attend at the Camp Kitchen to eat their lunches a Local Resident Employee shall be provided the same noon meal without cost to himself.
summary: If a project has a camp kitchen that is used by all non-local workers for lunch, then local resident employees must also be provided with the same noon meal for free.
logical_representation: IF is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND camp_kitchen_established (llm) == true AND non_local_workers_use_camp_kitchen (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(noon_meal)
reasoning: This rule dictates the provision of a meal under specific circumstances, which is a direct meal entitlement. Thus, it is classified as LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE.

name: Hot Soup for Local Residents
rule_text: In those instances where bagged lunches are provided to camp residents and hot soup is delivered to the jobsite, local residents shall be entitled to pick up hot soup as well.
summary: If camp residents receive bagged lunches and hot soup is delivered to the site, local residents are also entitled to get the hot soup.
logical_representation: IF is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND bagged_lunches_provided (llm) == true AND hot_soup_delivered_to_site (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(hot_soup)
reasoning: This rule provides entitlement to a specific food item (hot soup) under certain conditions, making it a LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE.

name: Overtime Meals for Local Residents
rule_text: Where a Local Resident Employee is required to work overtime, he shall be entitled to overtime meals in accordance with this Agreement.
summary: A local resident who is required to work overtime is entitled to overtime meals as specified elsewhere in the agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND daily_overtime_hours > 0 -> ENTITLEMENT(overtime_meals, 'as_per_agreement')
reasoning: This rule establishes the entitlement to meals specifically triggered by working overtime. This is a core rule type for LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE.

name: Guidelines for Determining Real Residency
rule_text: In making the determination as to whether a person is a 'Local Resident' for the purposes of the Collective Agreement, the following factors will be taken into consideration:  the dwelling place of the person's spouse and dependents;  personal property and social ties to the community;  residential ties elsewhere;  performance and purpose of residence in a particular community;  documentation of; (i) property tax and rent receipts, telephone, gas or other utility receipts; (ii) driver's license; (iii) vehicle registration or pink card; (iv) income tax; (v) unemployment insurance documents; (vi) voters' list registration; (vii) employee benefit fund administration registrations.
summary: To determine if a person qualifies as a 'Local Resident,' several factors are considered, including the location of their family, community ties, other residences, and various official documents like driver's licenses, utility bills, and tax records.
logical_representation: DETERMINE(is_local_resident (Unsupported)) BASED_ON('spouse_dependents_dwelling', 'community_ties', 'residential_ties_elsewhere', 'residence_purpose', 'documentation_proof')
reasoning: This rule outlines the criteria and evidence used to establish 'local resident' status. This determination is the prerequisite for all subsistence, travel, and accommodation allowances, placing it firmly within the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Foreman Wage Premium, Industrial
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $5.50 per hour above the basic UA Journeyman Industrial rates as listed in Article 8.01 of this Agreement.
summary: On Industrial projects, a Foreman's minimum wage is $5.50 per hour higher than the basic UA Journeyman Industrial rate.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' -> PREMIUM($5.50_ABOVE_JOURNEYMAN_RATE)
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific wage premium for a role (Foreman) on a specific project type (Industrial), which is a core component of calculating labor costs.

name: General Foreman Wage Premium, Industrial
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $7.50 per hour, above the basic UA Journeyman Industrial rates as listed in Article 8.01 of this Agreement.
summary: On Industrial projects, a General Foreman's minimum wage is $7.50 per hour higher than the basic UA Journeyman Industrial rate.
logical_representation: IF position_title (llm) == 'GENERAL_FOREMAN' AND project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' -> PREMIUM($7.50_ABOVE_JOURNEYMAN_RATE)
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific wage premium for a role (General Foreman) on a specific project type (Industrial), which is a core component of calculating labor costs.

name: ICCS Premium, Industrial Foremen
rule_text: Foremen and General Foremen who are Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor (ICCS) designated will be paid additional premiums of one ($1.50) dollar and fifty cents per hour.
summary: Foremen and General Foremen with an Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor (ICCS) designation receive an additional premium of $1.50 per hour.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND iccs_designated (llm) == true -> PREMIUM($1.50)
reasoning: This rule defines an additional wage premium based on a specific certification (ICCS) for supervisory roles, directly impacting the cost of worked time.

name: ICCS Premium Rate Cap
rule_text: In no event shall this hourly rate be greater than the applicable overtime rate plus the ICCS premium
summary: The total hourly wage for a Foreman or General Foreman with an ICCS designation cannot exceed the standard overtime rate plus the $1.50 ICCS premium.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND iccs_designated (llm) == true -> CONSTRAINT(total_hourly_rate (llm) <= overtime_rate (llm) + PREMIUM($1.50))
reasoning: This rule sets a maximum limit on pay calculation under specific circumstances, which is a critical constraint in determining the final cost of labor worked time.

name: Foreman to Journeyman Ratio, Industrial (Average)
rule_text: The average number of Journeymen under the supervision of a Foreman shall be twelve (12).
summary: On Industrial projects, the average ratio of Journeymen to a Foreman should be 12 to 1.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' -> CONSTRAINT(AVERAGE_CREW_SIZE_PER_FOREMAN == 12_JOURNEYMEN)
reasoning: This rule dictates workforce composition and supervision requirements, which is a fundamental aspect of managing and costing labor time on a project.

name: Foreman Requirement Threshold, Industrial
rule_text: The Employer agrees that there shall be two (2) Foremen once there are fourteen (14) Journeymen on the job.
summary: On Industrial projects, a second Foreman must be employed as soon as there are 14 or more Journeymen on the job.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND journeymen_count (llm) >= 14 -> REQUIREMENT(FOREMAN_COUNT == 2)
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific headcount trigger for adding supervision, which directly impacts labor costs and is therefore related to labor worked time management.

name: Welder Foreman Requirement, 15 Welders
rule_text: On projects requiring a minimum of fifteen (15) Welders; there shall be a Qualified 'A' or 'B' Welder employed as a Welder Foreman when fifteen (15) welders are employed.
summary: On projects with 15 or more welders, a qualified Welder must be appointed as a Welder Foreman.
logical_representation: IF welder_count (llm) >= 15 -> REQUIREMENT(WELDER_FOREMAN_COUNT >= 1)
reasoning: This rule dictates a specific supervisory requirement based on the number of workers in a specific trade, impacting crew composition and labor costs.

name: Welder Foreman Requirement, 25 Welders
rule_text: An additional Welder Foreman will be employed when twenty-five (25) welders are employed
summary: When 25 welders are employed on a project, a second Welder Foreman must be added.
logical_representation: IF welder_count (llm) >= 25 -> REQUIREMENT(WELDER_FOREMAN_COUNT >= 2)
reasoning: This rule sets a specific headcount threshold for adding additional supervision for a trade, directly impacting labor planning and cost.

name: Welder Foreman Ratio, Over 25 Welders
rule_text: and one (1) Welder Foreman for every twenty (20) Welders employed thereafter.
summary: After the threshold of 25 welders is met, one additional Welder Foreman is required for every subsequent group of 20 welders.
logical_representation: IF welder_count (llm) > 25 -> REQUIREMENT(ADDITIONAL_WELDER_FOREMAN_PER_20_WELDERS)
reasoning: This rule establishes a scaling requirement for supervision based on crew size, which is a key factor in labor cost management and project planning.

name: Foreman Wage Premium, C/I, Local 488
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $4.00 per hour ... above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 488 of this Agreement.
summary: For Local 488 on Commercial or Institutional projects, a Foreman must be paid a minimum of $4.00 per hour more than the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND (project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' -> PREMIUM($4.00_ABOVE_JOURNEYMAN_RATE)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium for a role, project type, and union local, which is essential for accurate labor cost calculation.

name: General Foreman Wage Premium, C/I, Local 488
rule_text: and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 488 of this Agreement.
summary: For Local 488 on Commercial or Institutional projects, a General Foreman must be paid a minimum of $6.00 per hour more than the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF position_title (llm) == 'GENERAL_FOREMAN' AND (project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' -> PREMIUM($6.00_ABOVE_JOURNEYMAN_RATE)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium for a role, project type, and union local, which is essential for accurate labor cost calculation.

name: Foreman Wage Premium, C/I, Local 496
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $3.00 per hour ... above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 496 of this Agreement.
summary: For Local 496 on Commercial or Institutional projects, a Foreman must be paid a minimum of $3.00 per hour more than the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND (project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND union_local (Unsupported) == '496' -> PREMIUM($3.00_ABOVE_JOURNEYMAN_RATE)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium for a role, project type, and union local, which is essential for accurate labor cost calculation.

name: General Foreman Wage Premium, C/I, Local 496
rule_text: and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 496 of this Agreement
summary: For Local 496 on Commercial or Institutional projects, a General Foreman must be paid a minimum of $6.00 per hour more than the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF position_title (llm) == 'GENERAL_FOREMAN' AND (project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND union_local (Unsupported) == '496' -> PREMIUM($6.00_ABOVE_JOURNEYMAN_RATE)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium for a role, project type, and union local, which is essential for accurate labor cost calculation.

name: Foreman to Journeyman Ratio, C/I (Average)
rule_text: The average number of Journeymen under the supervision of a Foreman shall be twelve (12).
summary: On Commercial or Institutional projects, the average ratio of Journeymen to a Foreman should be 12 to 1.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL' -> CONSTRAINT(AVERAGE_CREW_SIZE_PER_FOREMAN == 12_JOURNEYMEN)
reasoning: This rule dictates workforce composition and supervision requirements, which is a fundamental aspect of managing and costing labor time on a project.

name: Daily Travel Free Zone
rule_text: A forty-five (45) kilometer radius free zone from the center of the cities of Edmonton or Calgary; (Geodetic Monument) or around any place in which Employees are temporarily domiciled by the Employer shall be established.  The location of the Geodetic Monument for Edmonton is 101 Street and Jasper Avenue and for Calgary, the Calgary Tower.  No transportation or travel allowance shall be applicable within the free zone
summary: No transportation or travel allowance is paid for work within a 45km radius of the center of Edmonton, Calgary, or any temporary accommodation provided by the employer.
logical_representation: IF job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 45 FROM domicile_location (llm) WHERE domicile_location (llm) IN ('EDMONTON_CENTRE', 'CALGARY_CENTRE', 'EMPLOYER_PROVIDED_ACCOMMODATION') -> FORFEIT('transportation_allowance', 'travel_allowance')
reasoning: This rule defines a geographic area where a monetary allowance (travel allowance) is not applicable, which falls under the category of subsistence and remote work entitlements.

name: Major Project Transportation Review
rule_text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, on major construction projects located within the free zone, around the cities of Edmonton and Calgary, but beyond the city bus transportation system of those cities, where it is expected that the total construction workforce will exceed 500, the  affected  parties  shall  meet  to  discuss  the  viability  of  implementing  a  system  of providing transportation to the site.
summary: For major construction projects (over 500 workers) inside the free zone but outside city bus routes, relevant parties must meet to discuss providing transportation to the site.
logical_representation: IF job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 45 AND is_beyond_city_bus_system (llm) == true AND total_workforce (llm) > 500 -> OBLIGATION('parties_meet_to_discuss_transportation')
reasoning: This rule outlines an obligation related to providing transportation, a benefit often associated with remote or difficult-to-access work locations, which is conceptually linked to subsistence.

name: Camp Bus Transit Time Allowance
rule_text: Workers shall be paid an allowance for time regularly and routinely in excess of forty five minutes each way, for travel within the applicable free zone.  The allowance shall be calculated on the regular straight time base rate of each worker.  The allowance will be paid only to workers who ride on the provided buses, and only for the days on which they ride the buses.
summary: Employees who ride provided buses to a site within the free zone shall be paid an allowance at their straight-time rate for any travel time that exceeds 45 minutes each way.
logical_representation: IF travel_mode (llm) == 'PROVIDED_BUS' AND travel_time_each_way_minutes (llm) > 45 -> PAY((travel_time_each_way_minutes (llm) - 45) * 2 / 60) AT ST_RATE
reasoning: This rule specifies that time spent traveling under certain conditions is paid, making it a rule about how time is categorized and compensated, which is the definition of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Daily Travel Entitlements Beyond Free Zone
summary: For daily travel to projects beyond the 45km free zone, the employer must either provide transportation and pay a travel allowance, or pay both a vehicle allowance (per km) and a travel allowance.
logical_representation: IF job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE( (PROVIDE('transportation') AND PAY('travel_allowance')), (PAY('vehicle_allowance') AND PAY('travel_allowance')) )
reasoning: This rule establishes the monetary allowances and benefits for commuting to a remote worksite, which falls under the scope of subsistence allowances.

name: Daily Travel Allowance Calculation
rule_text: The travel allowance shall be calculated based on traveling at 80 km per hour, at the Employee's applicable base rate, from the point where the edge of the 45 km radius free zone intersects the road which takes the shortest, most appropriate route, to the project and return to the intersecting point.
summary: A travel allowance is paid for projects outside the free zone, calculated as paid travel time. The time is determined by the round-trip distance from the edge of the free zone to the project, assuming a speed of 80 km/h, and is paid at the employee's base rate.
logical_representation: PAY('travel_allowance') = ((project_distance_from_free_zone_km (llm) * 2) / 80) * employee_base_rate
reasoning: This rule defines travel as paid time based on a formula, which is a direct application of categorizing and compensating for time, hence it is LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Vehicle Allowance Exclusion with Provided Transport
rule_text: Where the Employer provides the transportation the travel allowance would be paid but the vehicle allowance would not be payable.
summary: If the employer provides transportation to a job site, employees will receive the travel allowance (paid time) but not the vehicle allowance (for using a personal vehicle).
logical_representation: IF is_transport_provided (llm) == true -> FORFEIT('vehicle_allowance')
reasoning: This rule specifies a condition under which a monetary benefit (vehicle allowance) is forfeited, which is a rule governing subsistence-related entitlements.

name: Travel Allowance Forfeiture for Work Refusal
rule_text: Employees who are transported to a job site but who refuse to start work at the prescribed time due to a picket line or other form of labour relations dispute will not be paid transportation or travel allowance for that day.
summary: Employees who are transported to a job but refuse to start work because of a picket line or labor dispute will not receive transportation or travel allowance for that day.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status (Unsupported) == 'REFUSED_DUE_TO_LABOR_DISPUTE' -> FORFEIT('transportation_allowance', 'travel_allowance')
reasoning: The rule involves forfeiture of both travel allowance (paid time, LABOR_WORKED_TIME) and transportation allowance (monetary benefit, LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE). LABOR_WORKED_TIME is chosen as primary because the travel allowance is calculated as paid time.

name: Pay for Transportation Delays
rule_text: When the transportation provided by the Employer for the conveyance of Employees is delayed by circumstances that are reasonably within the control of the Employer or the bussing company, the Employees shall be paid for all such time, providing the delay is in excess of 15 minutes, beyond the scheduled arrival time, up to a limit of two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rate.
summary: If employer-provided transport is delayed by more than 15 minutes for reasons within the employer's or bus company's control, employees will be paid for the delay at their straight-time rate, up to a maximum of two hours.
logical_representation: IF transport_delay_minutes (llm) > 15 -> PAY(transport_delay_minutes (llm)) AT ST_RATE UP_TO MAX(120)
reasoning: This rule mandates payment for waiting time caused by transportation delays, which is a form of compensated time and thus falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Travel for Mid-day Job Transfers
rule_text: If an Employee is required by the Employer to move from one job to another during working hours, the Employer shall provide the transportation or pay vehicle allowance at the rate established by the formula in 29.02 (a) above per kilometre traveled if the Employee uses their own vehicle. The Employee shall not suffer any loss of pay as a result of transferring between projects during working hours.
summary: If an employee must move between job sites during working hours, the employer must provide transport or pay a vehicle allowance. The employee's pay will not be docked for the travel time.
logical_representation: IF is_mid_day_transfer (llm) == true -> PAY(travel_time) AT ST_RATE AND (PROVIDE('transportation') OR PAY('vehicle_allowance'))
reasoning: This rule ensures that time spent traveling between jobs is paid, making it a rule about how work time is categorized and compensated.

name: Travel Pay After Shift Without 8-Hour Break
rule_text: Employees required to travel out of a city or town to another job after working a shift, and before an eight (8) hour break occurs, shall be paid for all time traveled at the rate of time and one-half the normal rate. If still traveling the following day, the Employee shall be paid the normal rate for time traveled during the regular working day only.
summary: If an employee travels to another job after a shift without an 8-hour break, the travel time is paid at 1.5 times the normal rate. If travel continues into the next regular workday, that time is paid at the normal rate.
logical_representation: IF break_between_shifts_hours (llm) < 8 -> PAY(travel_time) AT PREMIUM(1.5) ELSE PAY(travel_time) AT ST_RATE
reasoning: This rule specifies a premium pay rate for travel time under certain conditions, directly relating to how time is bucketed and paid, which is the definition of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Payment for Moving Camp Rooms
rule_text: Should an Employee residing in camp accommodation be requested by the Employer or the client's designated camp management personnel to move to another room or camp, they shall be paid two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rates to carry out the move.
summary: If an employee in camp is required to move to another room or camp, they will be paid for two hours at their straight-time rate for the move.
logical_representation: IF is_camp_room_move_requested (llm) == true -> PAY(2) AT ST_RATE
reasoning: This rule provides a specific payment for a non-work activity at the employer's request, treating it as compensated time, thus it falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Travel Allowance for Distant Subsistence Accommodation
rule_text: When an Employee is being paid subsistence allowance in accordance with Article 29.04 and when there is no suitable accommodation available within 45 km. of the project on which the Employee is engaged, the Employer shall determine the location of the nearest available suitable accommodation and shall determine the number of road kilometers beyond a 45 kilometer radius of the project that would be required to travel each way from the nearest available suitable accommodation, and shall calculate the travel allowance in accordance with those provisions as identified in Article 29.02.
summary: If an employee on subsistence cannot find suitable accommodation within 45km of the project, the employer must pay a travel allowance for the daily travel distance beyond that 45km radius from the nearest available accommodation.
logical_representation: IF is_on_subsistence (llm) == true AND accommodation_distance_from_project_km (llm) > 45 -> PAY('travel_allowance') FOR (accommodation_distance_from_project_km (llm) - 45)
reasoning: The rule is triggered by the employee being on subsistence and dealing with accommodation issues, making it primarily a LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE rule. However, the compensation is a travel allowance calculated as paid time, creating a secondary link to LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: C/I Daily Travel Beyond Free Zone
rule_text: For projects beyond the forty-five kilometre (45 km) free zone for which daily travel is required, then the Employer will provide transportation, plus a travel allowance to be negotiated in consultation with the Union, however, in the event no Agreement is reached with the Union then a decision shall be made by the Registered Employers' Organization, which decision shall be final and binding.
summary: For Commercial/Institutional projects beyond the 45km free zone requiring daily travel, the employer must provide transportation and a negotiated travel allowance. If no agreement is reached, the Employers' Organization will decide the allowance.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ('COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 -> PROVIDE('transportation') AND PAY('negotiated_travel_allowance')
reasoning: This rule establishes the entitlement to transportation and a monetary allowance for daily travel to remote C/I projects, which are core components of subsistence and travel benefits.

name: Out-of-Town Accommodation Options (<= 475km)
rule_text: When an Employee is directed or dispatched to work on an out-of-town job, the Employer will provide: (i) camp accommodation, which shall be available seven days per week; or (ii) mutually agreed room and board; or (iii) for each day worked, reimbursement toward the expense of the Employee's board and lodging... by way of a subsistence allowance...
summary: For out-of-town jobs within a 475km radius, the employer must provide one of the following: camp accommodation, mutually agreed room and board, or a daily subsistence allowance for each day worked.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 475 AND is_out_of_town_job == true -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE( PROVIDE('camp_accommodation'), PROVIDE('room_and_board'), PAY('daily_subsistence_allowance') )
reasoning: This rule directly defines the employer's obligation to provide or pay for lodging and board for remote work, which is the core definition of LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Additional Subsistence Day for Distant Projects
rule_text: On a project/jobsite located over two hundred and fifty (250) radius kilometers from the geographic centers of either the City of Edmonton or Calgary (as applicable) one additional day's subsistence shall be paid for the use of accommodation for the night following the last day worked, provided that the Employee presents a bona-fide commercial receipt to their Employer... Where the Employer or their client is providing a free bus trip back to the city on the same day as the last shift of the week, this provision shall not be applicable.
summary: For projects over 250km away, an extra day of subsistence is paid for accommodation on the night after the last shift, provided a receipt is shown. This does not apply if the employer provides a free bus ride home that day.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 250 AND claim_type (Unsupported) == 'COMMERCIAL_RECEIPT' AND is_free_bus_home_provided (llm) == false -> PAY(1_additional_day_subsistence)
reasoning: This rule provides an additional monetary allowance for lodging under specific distance and scheduling conditions, clearly falling under LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Subsistence on Statutory Holidays
rule_text: Board and room will be supplied, or the daily expense allowance will be paid for any Statutory Holiday which falls on a scheduled workday other than a first or last day of a scheduled shift provided the Employee reports for work on the workday immediately preceding and following the Statutory Holiday.
summary: Subsistence or room and board is provided for a statutory holiday if it falls on a scheduled workday, as long as the employee works the scheduled days immediately before and after the holiday.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true AND holiday_is_scheduled_workday == true AND worked_day_before_and_after (llm) == true -> PAY('daily_subsistence_allowance')
reasoning: This rule governs the eligibility for subsistence allowance on a specific day (a statutory holiday) based on attendance, which is a condition for a living-out entitlement.

name: Out-of-Town Accommodation Options (> 475km)
rule_text: Applicable beyond a 475-kilometer radius of the Cities of Edmonton and Calgary... When an Employee is directed or dispatched to work on an out-of-town job which will last at least five days, the Employer will provide, on a seven (7) days per week basis: (i) camp accommodation; or (ii) Mutually agreed room and board, or subsistence allowance...
summary: For out-of-town jobs lasting at least five days and located more than 475km from Edmonton or Calgary, the employer must provide either camp accommodation, agreed room and board, or a subsistence allowance, on a 7-day per week basis.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 475 AND job_duration_days >= 5 -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE( PROVIDE('camp_accommodation'), PROVIDE('room_and_board'), PAY('daily_subsistence_allowance') ) ON 7_DAY_PER_WEEK_BASIS
reasoning: This rule defines the employer's obligation to provide or pay for lodging and board for long-distance remote work, including the frequency (7 days/week), which is a core LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE rule.

name: Subsistence Forfeiture for Unreported Absence
rule_text: Employees failing to report for work on the workday immediately preceding and following a weekend or Statutory Holiday will receive the above for days worked only.
summary: If an employee does not report for work on the scheduled days before and after a weekend or statutory holiday, they will only receive subsistence for the days they actually worked.
logical_representation: IF reported_for_work (llm) == false on day_before_or_after_weekend_or_holiday -> PAY('subsistence') FOR days_worked_only
reasoning: This is a forfeiture rule based on attendance, directly affecting the payment of a daily living allowance, which falls under LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Subsistence During Work Stoppage
rule_text: Employees unable to work due to legitimate illness, material shortage, job site conditions, or inclement weather and for whom it is not practical to return to their respective primary Alberta residence... shall receive their board and room or daily allowance for those work days they were scheduled to work... up to a maximum of three (3) days.
summary: If an employee cannot work due to illness, material shortages, site conditions, or bad weather, they will continue to receive their room and board or daily subsistence allowance for up to three scheduled work days.
logical_representation: IF is_unable_to_work (llm) == true AND reason_for_unavailability (llm) IN ('illness', 'material_shortage', 'site_conditions', 'weather') -> PAY('subsistence') FOR scheduled_work_days UP_TO MAX(3_days)
reasoning: This rule ensures the continuity of a living allowance during periods of inactivity, making it a rule governing subsistence payments.

name: Prorated Subsistence for Early Departure
rule_text: If an Employee who is being provided with subsistence allowance chooses to leave a jobsite prior to the normal quitting time without receiving consent from their Employer, the Employee will receive a prorated amount of subsistence based upon the number of hours the Employee worked in the workday, compared to the regularly scheduled hours of work for the day.
summary: If an employee on subsistence leaves work early without the employer's permission, their daily subsistence allowance will be prorated based on the hours they actually worked versus the scheduled hours.
logical_representation: IF left_early_with_consent (llm) == false -> PAY('subsistence') * (daily_hours / scheduled_daily_hours (llm))
reasoning: This rule dictates how a daily monetary allowance is calculated based on hours worked, which is a rule about subsistence payment calculation.

name: Full Subsistence for Approved Early Departure
rule_text: If the Employee leaves prior to the normal quitting time with the consent of the Employer they will receive the normal daily subsistence allowance for that day.
summary: If an employee leaves work early with the employer's permission, they will still receive their full daily subsistence allowance.
logical_representation: IF left_early_with_consent (llm) == true -> PAY('full_daily_subsistence')
reasoning: This rule clarifies a condition under which the full subsistence allowance is paid, making it a rule about subsistence entitlement.

name: C/I Out-of-Town Accommodation (<= 475km)
rule_text: Where Employees are employed in the area beyond that in which daily travel applies and up to a radius of 475 km from the center of the cities of Edmonton or Calgary, as may be appropriate, the Employer may elect to provide: camp accommodations... or mutually agreed room and board; or subsistence allowance... to be negotiated in consultation with the Union...
summary: For Commercial/Institutional work beyond the daily travel zone and up to 475km, the employer can choose to provide camp, agreed room and board, or a negotiated subsistence allowance.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ('COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > daily_travel_zone AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 475 -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE(PROVIDE('camp'), PROVIDE('room_and_board'), PAY('negotiated_subsistence_allowance'))
reasoning: This rule defines the employer's accommodation and subsistence obligations for C/I projects in a specific geographic range, which is a core LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: C/I Out-of-Town Accommodation (> 475km)
rule_text: Beyond a 475 kilometer radius from the center of the cities of Edmonton or Calgary, as may be appropriate, the Employer, where their Employees do not return daily, has the same elections as above, but on the basis of seven (7) days per week.
summary: For Commercial/Institutional work beyond 475km where employees do not return home daily, the employer has the same options (camp, room/board, or negotiated subsistence) but must provide it on a 7-day per week basis.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ('COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 475 -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE(...) ON 7_DAY_PER_WEEK_BASIS
reasoning: This rule specifies the frequency and options for subsistence for long-distance C/I projects, making it a LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE rule.

name: Industrial Initial and Return Travel Allowance
rule_text: Employees directed or dispatched to a project/jobsite from which they do not return daily shall be paid travel allowance for initial travel and transportation to the project and return, upon termination of the job or their employment, based upon a radius from the cities of Edmonton or Calgary, as applicable...
summary: For industrial projects where employees don't return home daily, they receive a fixed travel allowance for their initial trip to the site and their return trip upon termination. The amount is based on the distance from Edmonton or Calgary.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND no_daily_return == true -> PAY('initial_allowance') AND PAY('return_allowance') BASED_ON_DISTANCE_BRACKETS
reasoning: This rule provides a monetary allowance to cover the costs of getting to and from a remote worksite, which is a form of subsistence benefit.

name: Employee Election for Remote Site Transportation
rule_text: When transportation is provided by the employer by way of air, bus, or other acceptable surface transportation... an employee, at the time of dispatch, will be allowed to elect to use the such employer provided transportation or to receive collective agreement initial/return/rotation allowances.
summary: At the time of dispatch to a remote site, an employee can choose between using employer-provided transportation or receiving the monetary allowances for travel specified in the collective agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_transport_provided (llm) == true -> AT_DISPATCH -> EMPLOYEE_CHOICE( ELECT('employer_transport'), ELECT('travel_allowances') )
reasoning: This rule provides an employee a choice between a direct benefit (transportation) and a monetary allowance, both of which fall under the category of subsistence and remote work entitlements.

name: Reimbursement when Employer Transport is Unavailable
rule_text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, an employee who has elected to use employer provided transportation and who is hired, laid off, or terminated on a day when such transportation is not available shall be reimbursed the cost of a one-way commercial bus ticket to Edmonton or Calgary, whichever is applicable, and transportation from the site to the nearest commercial bus terminal, or equivalent taxi fare.
summary: If an employee who chose employer-provided transport is hired, laid off, or terminated on a day the transport isn't running, the employer must reimburse them for the cost of a commercial bus ticket to Edmonton or Calgary.
logical_representation: IF transport_election (llm) == 'employer_provided_transportation' AND is_transport_available (llm) == false AND employee_status (Unsupported) IN ('NEW_HIRE', 'LAID_OFF', 'TERMINATED') -> REIMBURSE(commercial_bus_ticket_cost)
reasoning: This rule mandates a monetary reimbursement for travel when a provided benefit is unavailable, making it a rule about subsistence-related financial entitlements.

name: Vesting for Initial and Return Travel Allowance
rule_text: Employees will qualify for, and receive initial transportation allowance to the job site after being employed at the site for fifteen (15) calendar days or completion of the job, whichever is the lesser. Should the Employee remain on the job until completion of thirty (30) calendar days, or until completion of the dispatched job requirement, whichever may be the lesser, they shall receive the return transportation allowance...
summary: An employee qualifies for the initial travel allowance after 15 calendar days on site (or job completion, if shorter) and the return travel allowance after 30 calendar days (or job completion, if shorter).
logical_representation: IF MIN(calendar_days_employed (llm), job_completion_date) >= 15_days -> PAY('initial_allowance'); IF MIN(calendar_days_employed (llm), job_completion_date) >= 30_days -> PAY('return_allowance')
reasoning: This rule sets the time-based eligibility conditions for receiving a monetary travel allowance, which is a key aspect of managing subsistence benefits.

name: Industrial Rotational Leave and Allowance (300-475km)
rule_text: On jobs located beyond a Three Hundred (300) km radius to a maximum of Four Hundred and Seventy-five (475) km from the centre of Edmonton or Calgary or other hiring hall location, the Employer shall: (i) Pay an allowance... after thirty-five (35) calendar days of employment on the job and thereafter for each subsequent thirty-five (35) calendar days of employment... (ii) Allow employees five (5) working days leave...
summary: For industrial jobs between 300km and 475km from a hiring center, employees receive a monetary allowance and 5 working days of leave after every 35 calendar days of employment.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) BETWEEN 300 AND 475 -> AFTER_EACH(35_calendar_days_employed) -> PAY(allowance) AND PROVIDE(5_working_days_leave)
reasoning: This rule provides for both a monetary allowance and paid leave ('turnaround') for employees on remote projects, which are benefits designed to compensate for living away from home, i.e., subsistence.

name: Industrial Rotational Leave and Allowance (>475km)
rule_text: On jobs located beyond a four hundred and seventy-five (475) kilometre radius from the centre of Edmonton or Calgary or other hiring hall location, the Employer shall: (i) Provide a negotiated transportation allowance, not to exceed scheduled airline air fare where scheduled air service is available, or pay an allowance... after thirty-five (35) calendar days of employment... (ii) Allow employees five (5) working days leave...
summary: For industrial jobs more than 475km from a hiring center, employees receive a travel allowance (up to airfare cost if applicable) and 5 working days of leave after every 35 calendar days of employment.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 475 -> AFTER_EACH(35_calendar_days_employed) -> PAY(negotiated_allowance_or_airfare) AND PROVIDE(5_working_days_leave)
reasoning: Similar to the previous rule, this defines the 'turnaround' monetary and leave benefits for long-distance remote work, which falls squarely within the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE category.

name: Non-Credited Time Towards Turnaround Leave
rule_text: Time spent away from a jobsite due to a jobsite closure or scheduled vacation of one work week (5 days or 4 days as the case may be) or longer will not be credited towards the accumulation of calendar days for earning a turnaround leave.
summary: Time off for a jobsite closure or a scheduled vacation of a week or more does not count toward the 35 calendar days needed to qualify for a turnaround leave.
logical_representation: IF reason_for_absence (llm) IN ('jobsite_closure', 'scheduled_vacation_>=1_week') -> EXCLUDE(time_away) FROM 35_day_turnaround_accumulation
reasoning: This rule specifies what time counts towards eligibility for a subsistence-related benefit (turnaround leave), making it a condition of the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Annual Adjustment of Travel and Leave Allowances
rule_text: The Initial and Return Transportation Allowances and the Rotational Leave Allowances [applicable to Industrial work] set out herein shall be subject to review in January of each year... each allowance amount shall be adjusted by the same percentage adjustment as the vehicle allowance adjustment, effective the first pay period following May 1st of the respective year.
summary: The monetary amounts for Initial, Return, and Rotational Leave allowances for Industrial work are reviewed annually and adjusted by the same percentage as the vehicle allowance, effective after May 1st.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' -> ADJUST(initial_return_rotational_allowances) ANNUALLY based on vehicle_allowance_percentage_change
reasoning: This rule defines the mechanism for updating the rates of several monetary allowances related to remote work, which is a key component of managing LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Commercial/Institutional Rotational Leave
rule_text: For COMMERCIAL and INSTITUTIONAL Work, the allowance for the Turnaround Leave is to be negotiated between the Employer and the Union. (based on the Industrial format in Clause 29.07(a)(i)&(b)(i)), however in the event that no agreement is reached between the Employer and the Union a decision shall be made by the Registered Employers Organization, which decision shall be final and binding.
summary: For Commercial and Institutional projects, the turnaround leave allowance is negotiated between the employer and the union, based on the industrial model. If they cannot agree, the Employers' Organization will set the rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ('COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL') -> SET('turnaround_allowance') BY NEGOTIATION
reasoning: This rule establishes the process for determining a monetary allowance for turnaround leave on C/I projects, which is a subsistence-related benefit.

name: SPNA Effectiveness Term
rule_text: A SPNA shall be established upon completion of the process set out in this Letter of Understanding and shall be effective for the term set out in the SPNA.
summary: A Special Project Needs Agreement (SPNA) becomes active once the defined process is complete and remains effective for the specific term stated within that SPNA document.
logical_representation: SET_VALIDITY_PERIOD(start=spna_term_start_date (llm), end=spna_term_end_date (llm))
reasoning: This rule establishes that the labor conditions within an SPNA are bound by a specific term. This temporal constraint is fundamental to the application of all work time, pay, and allowance rules defined in the SPNA.

name: Contractor SPNA Eligibility
rule_text: A Contractor shall be a General Contractor on the date of application bound by at least four (4) Registration Collective Agreements.
summary: To be eligible to apply for a Special Project Needs Agreement, a Contractor must be a General Contractor bound by a minimum of four Registration Collective Agreements at the time of application.
logical_representation: IF applicant_type (llm) == 'CONTRACTOR' AND contractor_agreement_count (llm) < 4 -> INELIGIBLE_TO_APPLY_FOR_SPNA
reasoning: This rule sets a specific precondition for a contractor to initiate an SPNA, which alters standard labor rules. This eligibility requirement is foundational to the application of modified work time and pay structures, thus it's categorized under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: SPNA Applicant Eligibility
rule_text: An Owner, a Contractor or the Building Trades may apply for a SPNA.
summary: A request for a Special Project Needs Agreement can be initiated by a project Owner, a Contractor, or the Building Trades.
logical_representation: IF applicant_type (llm) IN ['OWNER', 'CONTRACTOR', 'BUILDING_TRADES'] -> ELIGIBLE_TO_APPLY_FOR_SPNA
reasoning: This rule defines who is eligible to initiate a process that modifies the standard labor agreement. As this initiation is the first step in establishing project-specific work time and pay rules, it is categorized under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: SPNA Template for Remote Projects
rule_text: If the project gate is beyond daily commuting distance (beyond 125 km of the city centre of either Calgary or Edmonton) the SPNA for the project shall be in the form attached as Template A.
summary: For projects located more than 125 km from the city center of Calgary or Edmonton, the Special Project Needs Agreement must use Template A.
logical_representation: IF (project_location (Unsupported) IN ['CALGARY', 'EDMONTON'] AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 125) -> APPLY_SPNA_TEMPLATE('A')
reasoning: This rule determines which set of labor rules (Template A) applies to a project based on its location. The selection of the template is a prerequisite for defining all labor worked time, pay, and allowance conditions, making it fundamentally related to how time is categorized and paid.

name: SPNA Template for Local Projects
rule_text: If the project gate is within daily commuting distance (within 125 km of the city centre of either Calgary, or Edmonton or within 45 km of the city centre of Red Deer) the SPNA for the project shall be in the form attached as Template B.
summary: For projects located within 125 km of Calgary or Edmonton city centers, or within 45 km of Red Deer's city center, the Special Project Needs Agreement must use Template B.
logical_representation: IF (project_location (Unsupported) IN ['CALGARY', 'EDMONTON'] AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 125) OR (project_location (Unsupported) == 'RED_DEER' AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 45) -> APPLY_SPNA_TEMPLATE('B')
reasoning: This rule determines which set of labor rules (Template B) applies to a project based on its location. The selection of the template is a prerequisite for defining all labor worked time, pay, and allowance conditions, making it fundamentally related to how time is categorized and paid.

name: SPNA Template Modification Constraint
rule_text: The only change to the applicable template shall be the location of the project, the scope of the work and the effective date.
summary: When creating a Special Project Needs Agreement, the selected template (A or B) cannot be altered, except to fill in the project's location, scope of work, and effective date.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: SPNA_TEMPLATE_MODIFICATIONS_LIMITED_TO(['project_location', 'work_scope', 'effective_date'])
reasoning: This rule constrains the content of the SPNA, ensuring that the pre-defined labor rules in the templates are applied without modification. This directly governs the worked time, pay, and allowance rules for the project, making its classification under LABOR_WORKED_TIME appropriate.

name: Default SPNA Effective Date
rule_text: Upon completion of the process set out herein, unless the Arbitration Panel rules otherwise, the SPNA shall become effective on the 31 st day after the SPNA is received from the Chair of the Coordinating Committee.
summary: Unless an arbitration panel decides otherwise, a Special Project Needs Agreement automatically becomes effective 31 days after it is received from the Coordinating Committee's Chair.
logical_representation: IF arbitration_ruling (llm) != 'otherwise' -> SET_EFFECTIVE_DATE(spna_receipt_date (llm) + 31_days)
reasoning: This rule defines the default start date for the labor conditions specified in an SPNA. The effective date is a critical parameter for all worked time and payment rules, justifying its classification under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Letter of Understanding Validity Period
rule_text: Whereas the Parties have entered into a Collective Agreement which shall remain in effect from May 4th, 2025 through April 30, 2029... This Letter of Understanding shall terminate with the expiry of this Collective Agreement
summary: This Letter of Understanding, which governs the creation of Special Project Needs Agreements, is valid from May 4, 2025, to April 30, 2029.
logical_representation: SET_VALIDITY_PERIOD(validity_start_date='2025-05-04', validity_end_date='2029-04-30')
reasoning: This rule establishes the effective date range for the entire set of meta-rules governing SPNAs. It is classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME as it defines the temporal boundary for applying these project-specific labor agreements.

name: SPNA Continuation Past LOU Expiry
rule_text: provided, however, that any SPNA established under this Letter of Understanding shall continue for the term provided therein.
summary: Any Special Project Needs Agreement established under this letter will remain in effect for its specified term, even if the main Letter of Understanding expires.
logical_representation: IF spna_term_end_date (llm) > validity_end_date -> SPNA_REMAINS_VALID
reasoning: This rule ensures the continuity of labor conditions defined in an SPNA beyond the expiry of the parent agreement. It is classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME as it guarantees the persistence of the specific work schedules, pay rates, and other labor rules established for a project.
